text: I have been here 3 times absolutely love the food and smoothies! Tastes so good its almost unbelievable that it is all healthy! Also, the service I received each time was awesome and fast. The tall blonde boy helped me each time and explained a lot about the menu and suggested his favorites. Will be recommending to all my friends and family:)

First time here and i left happy. Upbeat environment, and the food looked and tasted delicious. Don't worry...you get what you pay for here because the proportions adequate. And the protein shakes also as delicious. Coffee bean and Chipotle are dead to me now ;-)
I love this place food is amazing, always. Staff is super friendly and online ordering is simple!

Obviously a little pricey but then again its a health restaurant. I was already expecting it.

I ordered the LS Steak Burrito. It was really good. I love spicy so I was dipping it in Sriracha sauce but overall it was delicious. Very modern way of dining. EDM music playing.

Environment was clean and pretty good. Staff was friendly. I'm going to have to come back here a few times to have my final say but as of now, i wouldn't mind coming back
Besides the giant pictures of the transgendered bodybuilder plastered all over the walls, that make me feel uncomfortable and emasculated, this place is actually alright. Pretty good shakes.

Love it!! My fianc√© & I are doing a show on the strip & still we make our way out to Protein House daily. It has a great affect on our bodies & Larissa, Andrew & staff are great. Very welcoming. I love the Southwest bowl & protein pancakes best

After going into protein house today I won't ever step foot again. It was not clean at all, I had a hard time finding a clean table. The cashier was not friendly at all. I wasn't offered any help finding utensils nor given any. And let's top this cake off with some frosting.. My partner and I both have food poisoning almost immediately after eating here. Great job guys you rock!

Drinks are good.  The food is not fresh. I thought it was, but found out that they use pre-boxed veggie burgers...Yuck. Service was good & freindly.  You;d think that they would have fresh food since their prices are high.

I wish their was a Protein House near my hometown in Riverside, CA ( hint , hint )

The food was delicious and the atmosphere was awesome. The location looked clean and lean so they did a great job keeping it in theme.

The staff was friendly. Loved that.

I ordered a veggie omelette and a peanut butter dream protein smoothie. Both items were packed with flavor. I probably should have just ordered the smoothie because I'm now stuffed.

My co worker ordered a bowl that was also delicious. 

You can't go wrong coming here. Healthy , yummy and  clean ! I will come eat here at least once anytime I'm in Las Vegas.
I love this place. The south beach pancakes & steak wrap are my go to's. Place is delicious & love the decor.

My wife and I went there on Monday, 11/24/14 at about 615 PM. Staff was friendly enough and helped us navigate through the menu. There was only one other person in there who already had their order so it seemed like it took a bit too long to throw together two chicken Caesar salads. Salad was alright, but skimpy on the dressing. Not sure what they were using as the "lite" dressing we think it hurt our bellies afterwards. For the price I would have hoped that at least the lettuce was organic, but I don't think it was. The atmosphere was not what I expected - and the EDM music was way too loud. I'm all about eating healthy, but this place was more annoying than anything else. 

Also - read the menu before you go in. A lot of the sauces or parts of dishes include things that may not be ideal to one's diet such as stevia, agave nectar, etc. I guess it just comes down to your own personal diet preferences.

After standing in line with no service for at least five minutes I was greeted with the lovely salutation of "do you need something" to which I started ordering. Halfway through my order the lady give me a finger and told me to hold on while she answered the phone and proceeded to take another order. During this time she asked me to check if their were cookies out of her sight. After this a wonderfully rude customers walked right in front of me and was given service prior to me. The place smelled like a toilet when I walked in and that should have been my first indication of what a terrible establishment this was. Save your money and don't waste your time. Rude staff and stinky.

I just had a juicy, healthy, delicious, flavorful Turkey burger...that's right I said juicy Turkey burger! The service was great, the burger was juicy.  The atmosphere was nice, the burger was juicy.  The price was ok, the Turkey burger was juicy. My boyfriends teriyaki bowl was delicious but my Turkey burger was sooooo juicy. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone wanting a healthy, flavorful, good meal.

My first trip in but a little disappointed. Got the Power Wrap and the Green Monster juice to go. The juice is supposed to be cold pressed, but disappointed that the juice was warm. I know cold pressed doesn't mean chilled, but it would be nice to have a little chill to it. As for the wrap, I was super excited as it sounded delicious. The peanut sauce was not good. Very bland and tasteless. I feel like it doesn't compliment the hummus, and think this wrap may be better without the peanut sauce.  I'm sad because I really wanted to like this place but I didn't.

The PH breakfast burrito was delicious and the protein brownie was to die for ...they were right of the oven!!!!

Wish the calorie, fat, etc was displayed for each item.
Quality food. A little pricey, but you get what you pay for. If you want healthy, tasty food, then this is the spot

This place is amazing for a quick stop for an extremely healthy meal! Smoothies and food comes out extremely quick and they have so many different healthy options! Definitely my new go to place for a meal on the go or a protein packed meal after a good workout!

Beautifully presented food. The ingredients are very fresh and healthy which is why its not priced like burger kind, more like Wild Willy's which is reasonable. Bison burger is amazing, my friend had the Portobello sandwich which was equally good, had a bite. Seared Ahi Tuna salad had a great dressing. Really enjoyed the ambiance, owner Larissa seemed very friendly and approachable. Will come back again.
I love this place great post workout meal. Lots of options to choose from.

I wished I would have come here sooner! I love the extensive, creative and healthy menu! There are so many options of bowls, wraps, smoothies, salads, juices, desserts and many more wonderful items!  I had a hard time choosing but I went with the PH Hash - Ground Bison, Six Egg Whites, Grilled Sweet Potatoes, Red Onions, Celery and Peppers. It was so filling, yummy and guilt free for lunch! The atmosphere and decor is modern, sleek and clean with just a touch of sexy! The outside patio is furnished with bar tables and umbrellas...perfect for Vegas weather! Since I work out close by I will be stopping by PH on a more regular basis!

Rude staff, not very welcoming.  No hello, no thank you, dropped a dollar in the tip jar & didn't notice.  Should have put some coal in there.  Food was quite decent, definitely consider this healthy food.  I ordered the bbq chicken with quinoa, the portion was small and felt like there was an empty to-go container in my plastic bag.  A bit pricey for the lack of service and portion size.  Did I mention the service sucks?  Never going back, t madness is better

Stopped in for a smoothie. Not a huge variety in terms of smoothies. Most were whey-based. 

I prefer yogurt, so I got a strawberry-blueberry smoothie. For a 24 oz size it was almost $8, which is high for what I got: fruit, yogurt, and ice. In fact, the smoothie is quite bland, not much fruit taste. It mostly tastes like ice and yogurt. I could make about as good (or better) at home. 

Their effort was definitely more for the weight-lifting and fitness crowd. Most of the food menu was "jacked with protein." It took a long time to get service because you order at the counter and everyone in front of me was customizing their orders. I literally had time to go to the bathroom and get back in line without it moving. (Also, there was a mirror above the toilet in the women's bathroom???) They really need to move to an order from tables method if customization is such a big thing. 

The menu did have some unique items like bison, quinoa, and acai. Can't say if the food was good. My smoothie is subpar and the wait in line was way too long.

This place is a bit pricy.
However, when you want something healthy AND delicious, this is the place you want to go.

The service is moderate.
There's a cashier who takes your order (sort of like a McDonald's) except it's just a single register.
the cashier seemed busy between trying to answer phones and take my order.
The "kitchen" staff didn't seem to understand any English.
The decor is slightly intimidating. The walls (and bathrooms) are covered in pictures of body builders. Everywhere.
It made me feel slightly out of place while I sat down and ate. I'm all for working out, eating healthy, and looking good, but the decor limits the clientele. At least repeating customers.

Fantastic fresh and clean smoothies, vegan Protien available, protein pancakes and power omelette fresh ingredients quality chicken breast chunks and friendly staff. Ask for Andrew the Mgr, he'll give you a quick menu overview and make you feel right at home.

~London

Its an excellent place to eat. Go after you've done a workout and you'll be even happier with yourself. The portions are just right. 
The place gets busy, so don't be surprised if you wait a minute. But its worth it. The prices are fair because you get what you pay for, and that is wholesome delicious food. Definitely a must for fitness buffs and for people who enjoy healthy food.

Absolutley outstanding! Was visiting Vegas from my home back in Alaska and since im a health freak and am very strict on what I eat, I surely enough found Protein House while searching for healthy restaurants in Vegas. Came here on my fourth day in Vegas and the food was fantastic! Also ordered a strawberry banana protein shake to go along with the chicken salad I ordered. My mom enjoyed here chicken salad as well as my grandmother who enjoyed her burger. Will most defiantly make a trip here again when I visit Vegas next year. The restaurant was clean, quiet, wasnt to busy the time we came, and our food was made quick. Wish we had a place like this back home. Overall I had an amazing experience with Protein House.
My go to spot when I need good healthy food or a post meal workout. I've ate here several times and I am never disappointed. The food has great flavors and good portions. A must try from everyone!
Their customer service really bad.  It took 45 mins to get my meal.  I'm not impressed with their burgers.  I'm never recommend any of my friends
I am obsessed with PH! The breakfast burrito is my favorite menu item, though all the choices I've tried were absolutely delicious! The frozen yogurt is amazing as well. Such great energy in there.

Yummy a little expensive but yummy and good for ya!

The Terriyakki is yummy and the Thai bowl is my favorite.. my girl ordered the sexy bitch.

RATING: B +

SERVICE: A

AMBIANCE: B 

OVERVIEW: Placed an order for pick up. Overall the speed and service of this place was great. Walked into the establishment and they had a great seating area. Great service at the counter. I ordered the Monster Chocolate Protein Pancakes. If you're looking for a low sugar protein dense post workout meal, this is the place to order from. Pancakes do taste a tad bland due to the amount of sugar added. Chocolate syrup taste like whey protein mix. Very very hefty meal, and fairly pricey as well.

A bit pricy but good considering the menu caters to the  health conscious enthusiasts.  If you have specific macros they can cater to your needs.  I met the owner,  Larissa Reis, when I ate there and she is very down to earth and personable.  The staff seemed friendly. There's an array of condiments from sugar free ketchup to Sriracha, which again is fantastic for those with specific diets. The portion sizes are perfect,  leaving you satisfied. I wasn't too fond of the peanut butter smoothie which seemed too watery for my taste  but I'm used to tropical smoothie and Jumba Juice,  which really isn't fair for me to compare. The only con is I wish there was a Protein House on the north side of town...perhaps near the new LVAC ;)

I was introduced to this place by my trainer Derek. I met the owner he's such a sweet heart and has huge arms lol all the employees have always been very sweet as well. I've tried about 4 different things on the menu already PH breakfast burrito, sos salad, sexy bitch bowl and some other I can't remember! All of them were delicious!!! And not to mention healthy. Eating healthy never tasted so good till I found this place. I ALWAYS come after a session with my trainer & leave feeling good. I'm so sad this is their only location. Since I don't live so close to it! I can't wait till this place expands because we truly need more restaurants like this one!

What can I say? At least I tried it.  We even tipped the staff BEFORE the bad experience began.   Saw a post from a friend about the place so we were excited to try it.  First issue was with the staff with a bad attitude/bad service.  She didn't even say hello and seemed annoyed like she didn't want to be working.  Second issue was with the staff completely forgeting our order.  And it wasn't even busy.  We had to ask the cook (rude staff person was no help).  He did his best to rush the order.   Finally issue was that they completely forgot the juice that we ordered.  We almost had to get out our receipt to prove we ordered a juice, which was disappointing.    

It was $30 for two people and one juice, which is a little high for ok food and bad service.  Definitely a bad experience.  

On a good note, the place seemed clean and in order.  It seems like a good concept,  we just didn't fit in with the "meathead/gym culture" which seems to be the tone of the place.    Also if you are not wearing gym clothes, enter at your own risk.  Weird place.
We love this place! Everything we tried was amazing! We've been there 4 times and everytime they aimed to please! Price is a little pricey but worth it for quality of food and the environment

Healthy food, fresh ingredients, generous servings and close to the gyms!  A fitness fanatics paradise.  I've read a few other reviews on here & if you're not into "clean eating" than this place probably isn't for you.  

The food isn't doused in sodium, there aren't any soda machines & their condiment options include stevia.  Now this is health at its best.  Don't let the wall of bodybuilders intimidate you.  If anything, the staff is really friendly.  My only complaint is that my muscle-head BF & I would love to see another location in N. Las Vegas :)

1st time was last night 9/21. Good clean food, taste was good. Wife & I got smoothies for dessert, PB Dream & Muscle Freak, VERY good!! Only downside is the didnt have the sweet potatoe sticks, so got the mash instead & didnt have the portabella mushrooms either, but then again it was a Sunday night after the Mr Olympia weekend so its been busy. Overall good palce. Recommend.

each time I leave this place with a full belly I swear Im going to Yelp it. Today is finally the day!!! After eating here several times now I keep coming back for more. We have few and far places in Vegas for healty eating. Every item on the menu so far has been packed with flavor..Im in love with the bison burger and sweet potatoe fries. If your lucky the owner Larissa will there hanging out and for being a super fitness model is more than sweet and approachable. Keep up the good work Protein House!

Small place. Go there after at great workout.
Healthy food. Prices is okay. Everything is fresh. The staff could smil instead of just flexing all the time
Great place and great service. The bison burger was fantastic! Great selection of shakes! My wife had the bbq chicken bowl which was excellent. Want to back for their pancakes!

I discovered Protein House through a Groupon deal and had to check it out when I visited Las Vegas.  
I was very pleased with the food and the service.  I ate there three times (twice for breakfast and once for lunch) and loved everything they had.  My favorite was the muscle builder, which was two protein pancakes and six egg whites.  I am so glad Las Vegas has a restaurant where you can eat clean and with very little carbs.
I will be visiting Protein House each time I visit Las Vegas.

The food was wonderful -- a great Larissa's lunch special (Sexy Bitch) with salmon, quinoa, avocado, broccoli, mushrooms, spinach -- and affordably priced.  The low rating was because of a noxious cigar smoke smell that led me to go back home and wash my hair and clothes. Someone was smoking a cigar just outside the entrance.  Every time the door opened (which was frequently; it's a busy place) the smell permeated the entire place (and we were sitting at a table nearly the farthest away from the door).  The staff (much closer to the door than us) had to have smelled it, and did nothing.  Finally, we gave up waiting for them to take some action, and spoke to the manager.  The manager did go out and apparently speak with the smoker -- but nothing changed! The smoker continued to smoke and the staff did not seem to do anything else. Disappointed to say this, but we will think twice before going back.

The food is good for the most part. I've gotten a couple of things there now and they always forget my sauce. Every time. The sweet potato fries and mash are very bland. I know it's meant to be healthy, I get it, but when I cook for myself at home to make healthy things I add seasoning. 

The concept of the place is great and I really really want to like this place more but it's just cheaper and tastier to cook for yourself at home.

I really like protein house. It's been almost impossible to find somewhere healthy to eat in Las Vegas and somewhere that will actually fill you up! I can really taste the quality of the good food. I'm hard to impress, but I'm impressed.

It's a good place to eat.  Way overpriced though.  The owner (some body builder chick) has tacky pics posted up all over the inside.  The seating environment is not comfortable at all.  Food is always good though.

Healthy and tasty!
This is the big difference between them and greens and proteins. For who says they are expensive they make me laugh. The food averages between 10$ and 15$. I don't understand where they go to get a meal for less money  than that, McDonald maybe. They are always very polite. The cappuccino and smoothies are also very good.
I ordered the skinny salmon bowl and it was awesome. My hubby ordered the bison wrap.. We will be back

Love the concept. Who doesn't like healthy food fast? Building your own bowl or salad allows you to accommodate your tastes without dissecting a signature dish. Items were fresh, but both the salad and bowl lacked pizazz. Prices are steep. 2.5 stars.

Food was okay, the girl at the register is being rude. Two guys ordered the bowl of foods and then she walked and served them outside, when my number was called, I did not expect it was going to be SELF-SERVICED restaurant THEY CALLED ME TWICE so I decided to walk up, grab the bowl and eat disappointly! Because you treat unequally. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE! PRICE ARE TOO HIGH, 22$ for one small bowl and a smoothie? There are many good places to go other than this. I will not be returned

Webt hear with my 20yr daughter got a grill chicken salad " Very yummy" so was my daughters burrito , a little warm inside and chairs not my style we took to go , I HATE THE AREA , too much traffic in area ( highly congested) bring ur patience . Lol

I only been here twice and order only to go..both visits had the skinny bitch smoothie,it has a good taste,I love it so far.
It's a little pricey,$6.99 plus tax and a tip!
but they have to cover all of their expenses!
I'll be back for more!
Service is fast!

We really liked the food and the smoothies. The prices are a little on the high side but the food is clean and healthy. The owner seemed very friendly and made sure we were happy with our food. We will definitely be going back there for breakfast again.
Today I'm having the turkey burger with sweet potato fries good stuff and like always great service

Everytime my husband and I are in town we always make a point to stop by Protein House before coming to California. I must say, I look forward to trying out different bowls everytime I come. My favorite is the PH hash (Ground bison, egg whites, grilled sweet potatoes, red onions, celery, peppers) it travels well for breakfast and lunch on a Monday after traveling in a Sunday from LV to LA. I noticed they do meal preps as well and will look into that the next time we are in LV! 

Today's purchases: cookies & cream iced latte, caramel macchiato iced latte, a teriyaki chicken bowl, and the el jefe bowl with no pineapples. Extremely satisfied with our choices today! Can't wait to try their plant based menu next time we are in town!

Went in for breakfast this morning and had a great meal.  I had the pancakes with egg whites....wonderful meal.  My husband had the breakfast burrito and really enjoyed it.  Everything is freshly prepared and made to order. 

WE were really enjoying our time until we were ready to leave.  At this time, I watched as one of the employees climbed onto the food prep counter to grab a container of protein powder that was above her reach.  She stood on the food prep counter with her shoes on...yuck.  Would not have been that big of a deal...but she didn't disinfect the counter or even wipe it off before she started using the exact same surface to prepare a smoothie for the next customer.  She put fresh fruit and vegetables on the counter in the exact spot she was just standing.  She saw me watching her and didn't seem to think it was a big deal.  

I would assume this would violate a dozen or so health codes.  The bottom of shoes are filled with all kinds of disgusting things and belong no where near food prep.  After seeing this, I won't be back.  I don't think I can trust the cleanliness of the establishment.

This revelation makes me sad as I have always enjoyed my food here and raved about it.

Very impressed with the carrot, apple, ginger smoothie I ordered. A bit pricey, but don't mind spending the money for a great tasty healthy drink. I also ordered the chicken Caesar salad.  It was good, not great. Needed more chicken and maybe other veggies other than the pile of lettuce.  Dressing was okay, just too tangy for me.  Would have liked the more traditional homemade taste.  Still, I will return especially for the fresh fruit and fresh veggie smoothies especially. Staff is friendly.
Bodybuilder's IHOP.

Awesome healthy food great people great atmosphere!
Helping me get started right eating healthy!

Great food & excellent service! Always very friendly and helpful. I love the selection because I have 15 different food allergies and I can select meals without having anxiety about it. Plus it's healthy!
its a lot of money  for a little bit of meat.If protein house was made out of protein. If would look.like a shack...They messed up my order too..

I got a breakfast sandwich and a coffee. The staff was super nice and pretty fast. The coffee was good.  The food was okay. I love that they have ezekiel bread but my sandwich (eggs & cheese...I asked for no bacon) was kind of bland. Maybe the bacon usually carries the flavor? The atmosphere and the menu is definitely geared towards muscle-bound gym folks. I was surprised that the cheese on my sandwich was a bright (fake looking) orange color.  Local, organic ingredients would make this a 5 star.

So enjoyed this place. Being really health conscious we knew we wanted to hit this place while in Vegas. I ordered the Hash with Bison. Oh my gosh it was incredible. I have never had such tender meat. It was really so good. I ate the whole thing - though it easily could have been spread over 2 meals. We also ordered the pancakes to go and had them later. Just as good heated up I'm sure as they would have been in the restaurant. Steady flow of traffic which means they are doing well! :)

First time at ProteinHouse!!! Tried the Boss and Thai Monster. The bison from the Boss was super tender, but felt like the Thai could've used a little more sauce. Everything was fresh. On the expensive side, but you're paying for quality. Good food and guilty free!

You can make all of this at home for penny's on the dollar for the price of what you would pay here. 

Don't be a lazy American. 

Also, the music SUCKS

My coworker and I were looking for a healthy bite to eat after work and just so happened to pass by this place down the road. It has a really nice appearance outside and is very spacious inside. I love the contemporary ambience that this place has. From the lights to the dining room layout to the chalkboard menus, this place has a nice interior which gives off a modern, relaxed vibe. 

I love the whole concept that this place has. A healthy lifestyle is never out of style, and I enjoy their twist on it. The entrees make people realize that you don't have to eat a boring ole salad to eat healthy. Their menu consists of so many options that I can't wait until I go back to try more. They use healthier alternatives to certain foods such as egg whites, whey protein, quinoa, and stevia. I had the "Sexy Bitch Bowl." I loved the combination of flavors that this bowl had, which I would've never thought to combined. 

As for the service, it took someone a while to greet us and to let us know that they had a smaller more condensed menu. We were so overwhelmed by the chalkboards and kept having to walk back and forth around the counter, trying to look at everything. But the workers were very kind nonetheless.

Other than that, I highly recommend this unique place. Will definitely be back.

I like protein house, food is tasty and they have several options. My review is for their pickup order time through chowdown. I don't understand how an sandwich and two smoothies can take over 40 minutes. Why offer the service if they're not checking orders or receiving them
In a timely manner.  Not happy about this, people have jobs and things to do.  When I came to pick up my order after I didn't receive the second email promised they notify us that they just received the order ! This is 45 minutes after I received two email confirmations about the order by Chowdown and by Protein. Pretty disappointed.

Eating out can be hard when you're trying to stay on point. This place is great and leaves you feeling full. So far the sexy bitch bowl is my fave. Service can be hit or miss but if you're going out for service then hit a nice steak restaurant.

So, I was super excited to try this place! However, the experience was not what I had hoped for.  The food was good! I will give them that! Expensive, but good.  The staff, was something else.  The cashier/order taker...horrible. Plain and simple.  She was rude, did not know how to answer any questions about the menu, and when taking the order wasn't asking important things like what do u want on your sandwich!  The restaurant was messy, dirty tables, things not stocked, ect. My favorite pRt was when we asked for lemon for iced tea, and she walked away from the cash register, picks up lemon wedges with her bare UNWASHED hand and just hands them to me. Really?? 

A young girl came in for the night shift, immediately started bussing tables, and cleaning up while the other cashier leaned against the counter and watched her! It was ridiculous! After paying $60 for 3 sandwiches and 2 drinks, I doubt highly that we will go back!

It's kind of sad because we really like this place, right now we are eating our last meal at protein House. The food is a bit pricey but it's good so we like to come here. Today as I was paying for our food I told them my card did not have a chip, the employee looked frustrated and told me this would be the last time she could do this. She took my card and rung it up from her register. She told me the owner has had problems with cards that swipe (normal credit cards) and only excepts cards with chips in the future. The chip takes longer and is just as susceptible to hackers as the old cards. They are just inconvenient. There's literally zero advantage to using them. I've been told they don't want to take my money in the future so I won't waste my time coming here again. The bison burgers are good but they are not that good.

Cool cool spot !! Wow! The coffee , the pancakes .. Where to begin!!? So freakin good! I've seen this place all over social media and the bodybuilding , health conscious world and was excited to try it for months.  Super excited that I did and that it was worth the wait and the drive ! 
The cookies and cream sugar free coffee was delicious and a nice rich sweet morning treat.... Not my normal coffee cup but it was fun ! 
We shared the monster chocolate protein pancakes and had a side of PB with em.... Finger freakin lickin good , I mean I would have licked them off the floor !! So awesome and plenty to share, easily 2 meals .  Great stop and tons of options , fresh food and easy going staff.  Definitely will be back !

The foods ok, seems expensive but i don't know how much bison hamburger costs... the real problem is the wait time, 40 minutes for a burger and smoothie is a bit ridiculous. on top of that they give me the wrong side.  If they weren't apologetic / nice about it would have been a 1 star rating. 

i told the girl taking my order i didn't like sweet potato fries, so she was offering me alternatives, she said mashed potatoes? i say sure... little did i know she meant mashed SWEET potatoes... BUT they gave me sweet potato FRIES anyways! then when i told them i got mashed they gave me another side box with mashed sweet potatoes... so after spending 20+ dollars on a burger combo and a smoothie I'm going home with 2 orders of sweet potatoes i'll never eat... save your money and time, cook at home for cheaper, healthier, to your taste, and eat 20 minutes sooner.

Great place, self service, take care of yourself as you see fit. The food's made with care, light seasoning and a lot of veggies. My General bowl came with bison, broccoli and avocado. I can see why there are many body builders pick this place as daily meal place. They minimize the amount of oil and salt as least as possible. The price is a little pricy. $12-17 for a burger. My rice bowl costs $17.

I go there at least 3 times a week with friends. I love their protein smoothies, and my two favorite dishes is the sexy bitch bowl and the Turkey BBQ. Service is ok, it's great for post workout and food is really healthy. I love this place.
I love coming to PH, the smoothies and food are amazing. The staff is also really friendly and helpful with the menu.
Still great food, but a Protein Pancake Combo without the 6 egg whites is just Protein Pancakes. Not very happy right now after picking up food to go and finding out that my eggs are missing.
First time at Protein House and it was amazing! So glad we decided to try, hard to eat out healthy and they nail it. Return customers for sure!
I'm not a fan of this kind of food but my son wanted to go there because he eats those food and ho to gym every day. He loves it, so as my daughter.

Love this place. The protein pancakes look great I had the veggie wrap and I've had the vegan salad both excellent. The cold-pressed juices are also a hit. This place makes me feel like I need to be in the gym LOL
First time here. Great place. Had an awesome steak salad. Lots of fit people so draws a serious crowd (good thing).

Here now.  Excellent food.  Had a bowl with steak done mid-rare with avocado beans rice and tomatoes.  Done perfectly.  Will come back.  Getting food is a little odd though.  They give you a number to pit on your table only to find out you have to get up to get your food anyway.  Nonetheless, excellent place.  Was here quite a while using their wifi and they havent complained a bit. Asked for an order of brocolli after a couple of hours and thry were happy to oblige.

I absolutely love coming to Protein House, but today's experience was horrible! I ordered a PH burger without egg and lettuce. My order came out with lettuce and the burger. I was kind and told them this is not what I ordered as it should have been tomato and cheese. The cook seemed like it was such a hassle. He took the burger back, put cheese and tomato on the burger and gave it back. The burger was cold. I spent $12.97 plus 2.00 tip. I couldn't believe this is the service I got for how much money I spent on a burger. I don't know if I want to come back to this place any more. Very disappointed.

Food was ok,  ordered the southwest veggie burger supposed to have cilantro and black bean salsa couldn't find the cilantro and not enough salsa the little bite that was there gave the burger great taste, too bad it was only a spoonful in a big burger. Customer service was blah,  no smile waiting behind the counter. Atmosphere was ok.  
Next time going back to Greens & Proteins, better atmosphere,  flavorful healthy food w/ great customer service

My partner and I tried this place for the first time last night. We really looked forward to it because of its great location, health-minded orientation, and menu offerings. While this place is a great idea and has unimaginable potential, they are not quite there yet with her food preparation. I had the teriyaki bowl to start. The menu offers rice and quinoa, but I was left without the option when she took my order. I settled for rice, which is not my favorite, and was quickly disappointed by it being undercooked. After giving them the benefit of the doubt and not yet having my hunger satisfied, we ordered the bison burger that the rest of the reviews suggested. It is a big mean burger, that is for sure, but again we were disappointed with the food preparation. She gave us the option of how we wanted the meat cooked and we requested it be cooked "medium." Unfortunately, the meat was cooked very well done. Like I said before, the restaurant and its food has so much potential, but the way it is prepared influences and is impressionable on its customers most. If customers are going to be given the option I'm have something will be cooked, then that is how it should be cooked. I was under the impression that the folks who are running the grill we're under experience, and therefore we would be willing to give this place a second chance.

Torn between three and four stars: I wanted to be a fan, and I like the extensive menu of healthy options, but the actual execution and service are just A-OK. Come here to get specialized meals to meet your macros, whether you're going protein-heavy, low-carb, packing in the veggies, or all of the above, all in a modern, lounge-style setting. 

The SHRDD Salad (lots of quinoa, chicken, eggs, and veggies) and Skinny Bitch Bowl (with salmon, quinoa, veggies, and a cilantro sauce, a little basic) are some go-to items for me, often purchased in advance for weekday lunches and very filling. One of these days I'll try their protein pancakes.

I do appreciate that they have a ton of condiments (hot sauces, liquid aminos, etc) to dial up the spice or flavor in your dish.
A great place to go after a workout. The smoothies and bowls are pretty yummy. I'm a sucker for their pancakes. It can be pricey but it's pretty typical for a healthy joint.

Had the berry salad with top sirloin instead of chicken. It was good. Not great. Seemed I had a lot more lettuce than anything else. Also had the green machine juice. Not a ginger fan but I know it's good for u so I usually leave it in drinks like this. This time it was a little over powering. Probably wouldn't order it again. I will come back though. More items I'd like to try.

Protein House, I love you. I love you so very very much. Finally a restaurant that makes staying on plan while traveling easy, and actually DELICIOUS. So much so that I reworked my meal plan for tomorrow just to be able to go back and get two items off the menu. 

This time I got the aloha burger (lettuce bun). Holy juicy flavortown. My anti-healthy eating fianc√© got the general bowl and even he was blown away and said he would happily order it again.

Highly recommend. Prices are beyond reasonable, and the food is soooo worth it.

Great smoothies.  Whether you want to get big, recover from a workout or just be healthy.  Many to choose from.  

The entrees are diverse as well.  There is something for everyone packaged in a healthy meal.  Pancakes and breakfast burrito are perfect to get you going!

Yum  finally a place with a good sensible clean eating menu. 
Even my husband who isn't  a gym junkie enjoyed the Bison Burger with Sweet potato fries .
The chocolate protein muffin is delicious.
Will definitely visit again.

I come here about 3X a week when I'm in Vegas. I absolutely love the smoothies. The PB Dream and PB&J are my favorites. They are pretty expensive but big and delicious. I always call in my order so it's ready for me when I show up. They also sometimes have protein brownies which are unreal.
Amazing healthy food.. Great atmosphere and friendly staff.. Right across the street from where I work. I eat there 3-4 times a week and it's always great!
I cannot get enough of this place. I would eat it breakfast lunch and dinner EVERY SINGLE DAY. Just waiting for a franchise to open in the Long Beach/Huntington beach! Shut up and take my money!

I was drawn to the Illy logo in the window... Clearly this is a place for consuming protein, yet I needed a coffee.  Compared to the Illy Cafe at The Palazzo which was a huge letdown, this little place made a fantastic espresso! You can get a bunch of stuff in your coffee like whey and sugared or non-sugared flavorings if that is your gig.  Oh, and lots of really fit people, so suck it in, people.
Absolutely amazing great fuel for pre workout or post!!!! Smoothie was awesome.  Good atmosphere.
The PH Hash was awesome. Add avocado for a healthy fat. My wife had the veggie omelette and she thought it was good. All in all a truest healthy breakfast option, finally.

Their protein pancakes with egg whites were amazing great service , their southwestern bowl is also one of my favs 
Would recommend this place to everyone

No more juices..that means no more Green Monster Juice....waah...the person taking my order said they stopped making juices because it was not in demand, hard to keep ingredients in stock and it's hard to make? You still can order smoothies though and they did manage to come close to making my drink, just in smoothie form. Still 4 star worthy since I like the ingredients to make my custom bowl of Quiona,Turkey Burger, Pineapple with Cilantro Lime dressing.

Absolutely love this place. Prices can be a little too high on certain items but the portions are pretty big with lots of options to choose from (went once and now I'm hooked)I LOVE  the loaded protein pancakes topped with all the fruit. The bison wrap is also another one of my favorites! I can't wait to go back to try the snickers coffee with my protein pancakes.

I am going to steal Molly's description when I say this place looks like Greens and Proteins, if Greens and Proteins were a night club. It is located in the plaza off of Eastern and Richmar near Grimaldis.The restaurants is spacious with a modern flair to it. It had abundant seating between the sleek tables and comfy couches. The menu had standards items, or you could build your own masterpiece of healthy deliciousness. They serve breakfast, burgers, salads, bowls, juices and smoothies. I opted for the Greek Bowl: ground up turkey burger, roasted tomato, black olives, feta cheese, cucumber, and red onion. These items come on top of your choice of either brown rice or quinoa; I went with quinoa. I tossed some sriracha in there, because I am an addict and I admit it. It tasted phenomenal and the portion size was enough for two meals. The price was a bit steep - $9.99 plus tax for the bowl. The Yelp check in was 10% off, but I am not sure if they still have that promotion. It is definitely a great option for when you are trying to eat well, but not skimp on the flavor. The staff was friendly and patient. I am excited to try more of their menu.
Awesome customer service from Nayeli. This is the fourth time my wife and I dine in, and she has always made us feel welcomed. Thanks alot nayeli. We love the food.

I feel like this was overpriced for what it was. I ordered the gluten free pancakes, about which I was really excited. For $12, I got two very thin pancakes (common in GF pancakes but I've had fluffy ones). I could really taste the protein powder and its distinct aftertaste. I was overall unimpressed, though I may return to try a smoothie or juice.

I ordered the southwestern veggie burger with a side of sweet potatoes . The patty was delicious but everything else lacked flavor . I don't think it came with the black bean salsa as stated on the menu and the sweet potatoes were terrible ! Stick with Greens & Proteins or Protein SOURCE for great flavored/low calorie food & awesome customer service at a lower price .
They have great clean food and have always been patient with custom orders too. I also like the coffee and matcha drinks. Quinoa bowls are a fave with mixed vegetables!
Good but slightly overpriced! $17 for a small burger. Peanut butter smoothie is great though!

This is by far THE go to place for clean food that tastes awesome as well! I found myself eating here twice a day on this trip out here and feel slighted when I'm not close by and have to eat elsewhere. Nothing compares to it!

Andy and Larissa definitely hit a home run when they opened this place, and the customer service is beyond reproach!

I only hope they open another one in southern Cali someday. 

My favorite dishes are the Greek bowl and the P H bowl! Amazing!!

I was visiting a friend and we went to the Protein House for lunch one day. I tried the Buffalo Burger and it was excellent, although a little pricey. Great atmosphere, friendly staff, diverse menu. I'll definitely return.
This is the spot for healthy eating and drinking. My go to spot after leaving the gym. Nothing is better than their food. Your missing out if you haven't been there.

Needed something healthy but craved a burger, it definitely delivered on that end. Walked in and it smelled like a sweaty gym locker, not sure if that was intentional from the slogan "eat clean train mean get lean." Menu was on the pricey side, but I consider worth it for its healthy alternative nature. Had the PH burger and a PBJ protein smoothie. Both excellent, the burger comes a little bland at first but there are a multitude of condiments to tailor your food your liking, or as I saw it, level of healthiness. I added just katchup, and some salt to the sweet potato slices that came with it. The lettuce was chopped into tiny chunks which kept falling out, I would have preferred larger leaves to stay together better. Overall I'd come back, not sure how old the place is but it could use a little tweaking including decoration which was a little sterile. It seemed endorsed by one athlete named Larissa Reis whom I've never heard of but her picture was everywhere. She looks fantastic, if that helps the place any. Get some air fresheners.
Really great healthy options. Not always consistent though. Something will be delicious one time and then not so much the next time. Not sure why that it.

Looking for something healthy and I found a spot since I am going carbless while in Vegas. 

Once I entered the restaurant, the interior decoration was really nice inside it's like a fitness junkies heaven! 

The food was delicious and the order came out fast. 

Food: 
Had ordered the portobellos chicken sandwich with a side of sweet potato. They also have condiments which included hot sauce and honey. 

Everything healthy! Protein goodness

Teriyaki salmon bowl. Overpriced for getting a kids size meal. 12$ and they ask for a tip on the receipt and can't even greet or smile to their customers. No flavor. Very bland. Couldn't even taste the teriyaki sauce. Would have rather went to in and out for a double double protein style burger. 

Still hungry & I don't know what the hype is all about.

Sitting in fun atmosphere but 20 min to make a shake is not a reason to come back.  It's now 255 and I walked In at 230 for a muscle freak and there aren't a lot of people  here. Some people are getting their foods before me as they ordered AFTER ME. it's bad customer service :( not coming back as quick as I thought I would.

Restaurant is clean & the menu is has some very creative items.. They serve breakfast meals, burgers, bowls, protein frozen yogurt, smoothies, etc. I have only been twice.The first time, I had the pleasure of meeting the owner Larissa Reis, who was a total sweetheart. I ordered the Acai bowl, but they had run out of Acai.. so she made a great recommendation for something else. Second time around, I waited for my to-go order for quite sometime. I will be back to try again, though.

Came here last month and got a chicken Cesar wrap that was phenomenal. Came into and the wrap was complete opposite, not mixed well chicken was tough and not put together well. Somebody bring back the old chef please.

I am a big fan of the clean meats and produce Protein House uses. I usually do the create my own. I've found they often forget ingredients, but are always happy to make it right. This is a great location with friendly employees.

I pass by here once a week on my way home from school to grab their amazing PEANUT BUTTER DREAM. I don't even need to work out to want one, I just do! My boyfriend loves it as well. Highly recommend. 

You can't go wrong with their seared tuna salad either, excellent.
Great food and great service. My first visit had Monster Thai bowl and smoothie. Friend had Sexy Bitch bowl, outstanding service with simple atmosphere  .

Okay, protein house has a pretty solid but the outcome is pretty much a hit or miss. For the prices, you would expect amazing healthy food. Well, it is healthy! But many times the taste would be mediocre. I had several times when my food came out really dry and lacked taste, which is why I barely visit anymore for the food. I now come for their protein shakes and acai bowls! Those are pretty good but because of the prices, I definitely only come in when I'm craving for their items badly

First time trying this place, grabbed lunch while out running errands.  Got the Southwest bowl with brown rice and it was amazing!  Rather expensive for lunch but very filling and the steak was great.  I will be back for sure...maybe for dinner?  Looking forward to trying a smoothie next time.

Wasn't impressed when they first opened but now one of our favorite places! The protein pancakes are awesome and I always get the salmon bowl. Everything here is good it's hard to choose and the people working here are super friendly.

Excellent healthy food, for everyone who cares about it. I definitely recommend it to all of you to try! I wish I live close by.
Osss

Of course everyone knows that this is the best restaurant in Las Vegas!! 
Best pancakes everyone can have!! 
Thank you Larissa Reis!!

4 days in a row... luvin'it!!

Soooo about thos joint. Totally awesome. A little far for me but totally worth the drive. If your into healthy food then this is def the spot. Tue steak burrito o had was super clean with egg whites avacado and whope grain tortilla. The acai bowl here was also really bomb. Def recommend this placee to all who enjoy good straight up clean food.m

Best place in town for healthy Eats! I love the breakfast they make everything fresh! Super friendly staff they have no problem making things custom for you I'm dieting right now so I can't have any carbs they made me the most amazing Bison Burger wrapped in lettuce. Soooooo juicyyyy. They even have Crystal Lite instead of soda.  Definitely a must for those who want clean yet tasty eats!

The food is great. Service terrible. Every time I go there is something wrong that is not my fault & I end up paying for it. It's really too bad because I really liked this place and kept giving them chance after chance. I will not go here again

My health crazed boss got me so excited when she told me about the Protein House because she said the menu items were healthy an tasted Great but I was less then pleased. 

I ordered a BBQ chicken bowl with brown rice and added pineapple. The BBQ sauce is supposed to be healthier because they use Splenda instead of actual sugar and the taste DEFINITELY suffers. I also thought the portion of the bowl was small for $10 but i did get full really fast. 

I love the idea of the place and I want it to do well but this is more of a place to go when you want to eat out but not feel guilty about it, but like any place that promotes healthy food suffers in the taste department.

The food is amazing. Pricey... But good. 

The person taking my order however... Well... Thats another story. :(

This is definitely a bodybuilder's/fitness paradise!!! If you want unhealthy, deep fried, useless calorie dense meals, this is NOT the place for you. Wish we had one of these joints in AZ!!!! The price is a bit high but for healthy food that nourishes your body/muscles, you can't put a price tag on that. I ordered the Sexy bitch bowl with lime/cilantro vinaigrette. Super tasty & healthy. My sister ordered the Aloha Ahi burger with sweet potatoes. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!

This place is nicely decorated and ambiance is nice.  They always have fitness magazines scattered throughout in order for you to read. They even gave away some preworkout powder on the counter.

Also there is no fountain soda drinks, just tea from what I can see.

I had the PH burger with sweet potatos and it was surprisingly very delicious.

I really like this place.  A tad pricey, but reasonable considering they are serving real food and folks, real food costs more.  Serving sizes are generous, unlike many health oriented restaurants, and mine (teriyaki bowl with salmon) was perfectly prepared.  Salmon was moist and the vegetables still had some crunch. I would recommend it highly.   Oh the service.  Yes they do seem a bit disconnected, but not a big deal IMHO.   

I hope they make it.  The world needs more dining options like this one.

Ive Been here a few times. The food here is very delicious, freshly made with fine ingredients. there is a ton of things to choose from, they even have breakfast & healthy deserts they sell. Portions are pretty good here, i usually cant finish my bowls, they are filling. Greek bowl & south western bowl... YUMM. The brownies here are amazeballs!! can NOT believe that they are healthy. The reason im giving this place only 3 stars is because of my experiences here, the staff isn't as nice or lively as i like, its like they are too cool to smile or something especially the guys! I will also say a few of my clients that are a over weight have told me they feel a bit discriminated coming here/ unwelcome because of their size. But i dont really think this place is inviting either and im pretty fit. Also this place is on the pricey side. Might as well go eat at an actual restaurant where people serve you the food and refill your drinks, just saying. I am not hating on this place tho i will definitely be back because the food is to my liking.

Amazing! 

I had the chicken sandwich in between portobello mushrooms as buns. This is a great place to come if you're all about that paleo life like I am. I'm not sure if any of their ingredients are organic but I would be pretty disappointed if they weren't since this isn't the cheapest place to eat.

After passing by this spot several times and being hesitant of the prices I finally decided to give it a try. Wow! The smoothies are delicious! Jam packed with protein and other healthy ingredients. You definitely get the best value for your money when it comes to their smoothies. Muscle Freak (I believe is what it's called) is my favorite. Service is also very friendly. My husband tried the Chicken Caesar Salad and very much enjoyed it. Great place for healthy but yummy food.
If you have a regular diet go here, if you have a strict diet go to protein house!! Amazing place to go to can't wait to go back..

My beautiful wife is training for a bikini competition so we decided to check this place out!  My wife follows Larissa on Instagram so she was familiar with Proteinhouse.  Learning about Macros and all this healthy stuff is new to me but she was happy they had things counted for her and made it easy to decide what to eat.  We both had the Steak Burrito and it was delicious!!!!!  I would most definitely recommend this place to ANYONE, not just the health nuts.  Yes the decor caters to bodybuilding and fitness buuuuuut after all it is a healthy place to eat and the amount of time and effort that is put into those competitions, I would have my photos on the wall as well!  To all the negative reviews on here due to decor and or uncomfortable due to photos on the wall, save it.....I am probably the most unhealthy person that has walked through those doors and I loved the vibe and motivation this place offers!  Keep up the good work Proteinhouse, I would also like to get some franchise opportunity info if you happen to read this review.

I know that the Protein House has to make money, but they should be giving two different portion sizes based on hunger level. Having to add extra meat for $3-$4 makes it expensive for a salad. I ate there with a colleague and our meal was $33. Seems a little pricey for what it is and there are plenty of other places you can go around Eastern to get a better meal for $10 cheaper, with the same amount of protein or more.

In a pinch, I'll go back, but would much rather choose any other place where I can get a decent portion size and at least 28g of protein.

Talk about some hearty healthy food but with flair since my first impression walked in was is this ultra lounge for body builders or workout fanatics. Really not often you walk into health conscious restaurant see lounge area that can sit down got just about every fitness magazine laid out for reading pleasure (from muscle & fitness, just about every one can think of) but yet still have bar stools and tables relax have meal. One more thought with different. If ever lost in the world of fitness or IFBB need too know who current just walk into the bathrooms. Think kind of weird but too each his own. 

Now what really matters the food. It was my first time so really had no idea direction too go. It decent size menu so had just about every healthy option can think of. I like  the way the menu is structured from bowls, salads, burgers, and drinks. Each list typical healthy options comes too if want switch around protein, carb, add, or build your own healthy creation. I stuck with standard since was my first time. I went with the Southwest Bowl and Berry Jubilee for my drink. The Southwest Bowl was AAAwesome! I went with whole wheat pasta for my carb choice between brown rice, quinoa, or whole wheat pasta. I loved the fact that it was HEARTY healthy bowl. I always associate healthy with bare minimum of portion. At Protein House not cheating you out of your protein/carb! The top sirloin was cooked too my exact temp and combine the avacado, roasted tomatoe, roasted red pepper, cheese, and black bean salsa. Nice light sauce neither oily, greasy, and just light/refreshing pasta bowl. I could eat healthy everyday. It between pricey and cheap so not sure if could eat Protein House style healthy everyday. But without doubt you get the most bang for your buck hands down compare too other health restaurants. Look forward too trying more of the menu.

The service was fabulous. One that make point not too go at the last second. Really wanted too try Protein House. 30 minutes is broader line. The whole staff never rushed us although my guilty conscious made me eat faster... Even when I apologize when we first walked in asked if ok they greeted us with smile and walked us through the menu for newbies.

Sexy bitch bowl. It's what's for lunch. Great blend of fish veggies and rice with avocado. Filling and fresh.  Green monster is a routine order I love the greens with the fresh taste of coconut water. Great spot for a healthy bite.

This place was good the first time around but the service is super slow and one of the ladies decided to change the trash, hand me my food, and not wash her hands. After today, I will never eat here again.

Been back to Vegas quite a few times and always make a point to stop by this restaurant. This place is here to provide CLEAN eating to people who follow healthy lifestyles. There isn't table service- you order your food, grab a number, and pick up your food when it is ready. I have had the thai monster bowl, sexy bitch bowl, and the steak burrito and thoroughly enjoyed ALL. Loved adding sriracha to everything as well. If you want clean eats, eat here. Last visit 11/20/14.

This is my go to place for healthy food when I'm on the go! Everything here is delicious. Calling in an order is a breeze, and they also offer online ordering. Get the El Jefe bowl and thank me later!

Decent place to grab a healthy item. Their menu has a ton of selection! Nice! But...my breakfast burrito was sort of bland and they had no salsa for it. I Thought they should not be serving food on an old piece of wood. It seems a bit unsanitary. The staff were fairly nice and the place was clean. Id give it another try since their menu is huge.

We stopped in on a Sunday afternoon to experience this new place.  I am pretty open when it comes to my food even with watching calories.  

I ordered the PH Pancakes and my hubby ordered the Bison Burger wrapped in lettuce.  The pancakes were a nice multigrain, whey protein and it seems like a touch of cinnamon.  I have to say they were awesome.  My six egg whites were delivered on the side and were good as well.  I mean, you can't mess up egg whites.  My hubby was disappointed in the Bison burger as he felt it was rather bland, nor real seasoning at all.  

Now, the reason I gave them 3 stars was all about the service. Service here is horrible.  We ordered our food and it took 45 mins for it to all be completed.  There were two other couples that ordered ahead of us and were already seated when we walked in the door to order.  Several other groups of people were served before we were including the two couples already seated.  I went up to ask if our order was misplaced.  My hubbies burger had been sitting on the counter for 10 mins and they didn't call us as they were still making my order of pancakes.  
One of the other couples there said they had the same problem. 

Now the place itself is a great industrial design.  But they have the music blaring so loud that  you literally have to be sitting next to the kitchen to hear when your name is called for your food. 

If you are into healthy food, I have to agree they are good but if you can, call ahead for pick up because the wait is just not fun. And be prepared to pay a little higher for your food than other places.

I was so excited to try this place when my friend told me about it. Sadly, it didn't live up. Before I go on with my review, I will say my other two friends who ordered different dishes enjoyed their food. My other friend and I ordered salads (low carb day, ugh) with the seared ahi on top. I got a side of the sweet potato sticks. The seared ahi was so not fresh, it was kinda gross. I was a little nervous to eat it but I was starving so ate it anyway. It looked like frozen ahi that was thawed and it tasted really fishy. I was not a fan. The sweet potatoes were so undercooked, they may as well have just served them to me raw. I'm not sure if I'll come here again, if I do I definitely will not be ordering the seared ahi salad again. Great idea for a restaurant though. 

P.s. Why does the ice machine have a bunch of grime around the mouth of the dispenser? That was also a nono.

Traveling for work, I love protein shops. This place has a really good Skinny Bitch shake that's vanilla protein, strawberry and pineapple or banana. I don't remember which it was but it was really good and really filling. I di try a protein bowl but my shake filled me up, I couldn't really eat it. I did double veg vs. rice for same price. Awesome. I wish we had one of these in MN!!
Everybody needs to come here!! It's heaven yuuuuuuuuummmmmm!!! I recommend it to anybody and everybody. Everything is just so good and Delicious.

This place is pretty cool.  I am truly religious to my fitness regimen and I like that i can get my fix to an S load of protein immediately following my workouts. However, prices are a little high for my liking and there are douchey fitness photos/magazines decorating the tables, walls, and website. Get over yourself Larissa Reis. Decent place overall though.

Protein House caters to those who want a good bite without increasing their waist size in the process. I have been here a few times now and can say the food is definitely great quality. Downside is the price tag that comes with it. It's an expensive lunch, you're looking to spend around $12-15 per person here, so don't be surprised. I have tried the breakfast burritos, bison burger, and the Greek bowl. All are awesome for the clean eaters.  Customer service is so-so, they all seem pretty quiet and reserved here.  Doesn't change the fact that I can get a good, lean, protein packed meal squeezed into my busy schedule or after a good lift.

One of the most frustrating things as a consumer is to feel the need to check your take out order for accuracy before walking out. I should have known from my 25-minute observation while waiting for our 2-item order that I should not have stepped foot out of this place without checking my order. So, here I am stuck with a lunch I won't eat. I ordered ahi, cooked all the way through... No pink, I explicitly stated. Ahi I got was as pink as can be. I ordered brown rice. No rice to be found. I tried calling the restaurant just to let them know and it goes straight to voice mail.   Anyway, maybe I'll give this place another chance, but I'd better make sure that I have a good 30-minutes to wait for my food.
Clean and fresh atmosphere, walking in your privy the kitchen and all cooking elements. The service is friendly and the food is delicious!

Food is good no doubt. Only thing I struggle with every time I'm here is walking in and trying to figure out the menu. Stuff is written on the boards but with no description. You have to grab a physical menu to get into the ingredients of each dish, yet you have to order at the counter right as you walk in. It's a bit of a hassle so I end up just going to my Caesar salad with Chicken which is awesome! Love they have Chrystal Light options at the fountain drinks.  Very good option for health buffs and muscle peeps trying to enhance their meals with protein.

I was REALLY excited to try this place since I follow them on Instagram and actually it was the first thing I did as soon as I landed in Vegas.

We got there Saturday morning and it was empty. We looked at the menu for about 5 minutes and there were a couple of girls at the registrar that didn't bother to ask if we had any questions despite our confused looks. I decided to play it safe with the breakfast burrito and some much needed coffee after a 5am flight. They use illy coffee which is one of my favorite coffees and one of the best coffees out there. The cookies and cream coffee with almond milk was amazing.

Something interesting that happened was that once I placed my order I received a number, however no one delivered my food. I had the cook loudly yelling my number several times like if I was in a meat market. Who by the way was not friendly at all and looked like he hated his life the whole time.

The breakfast burrito was bland and had to soak it in Cholula sauce to make it taste better. Along with my burrito on the side there were some pieces of fruit (pinneaple, melon, and something else) the fruit looked and tasted old, you could tell that it was cut at least 1 or 2 days ago.

Before leaving I TRIED buying one of their tank tops however it's a mess and they are all scattered in no order next to the registrar. After looking for about 6 minutes and seeing that the girl at the registrar was not going to offer any help I asked her if they had some more in the back with my specific size. She replied with "that's all we have" and then I asked when were they receiving more since I was going to be in Vegas for the weekend and was willing to drive back to the restaurant to get the shirt. She replied with "I don't know when we are getting more, maybe next month or 2 months." I decided to not buy anything and left the restaurant.

To say the least I was disappointed with my experience, however I will give them another chance and check them out next time I'm in Vegas, hopefully their customer service and food gets better.
This is a great place to get delicious, healthy, satisfying meals and drinks (juice, smoothies, coffee).

For super healthy - this place does a really good job. Especially for bodybuilders and aesthetically fit individuals. 

Some of my favorites:

LR steak burrito
Sexy Bitch Bowl
Muscle Freak Smoothie
Acai Bowl

And of course - The Chocolate Protein Pancakes with protein yogurt!
Holy crap are they good! Dry...yes - but for a protein pancake these things taste awesome!

Pricy yes, but great place to go to eat healthy.
Poor service. And unfriendly. Asked if they had military discount. They said yes but too late.  Already rang you up.  Good food. Bad service.

First thing I noticed was the music they play here, I walked in & I instantly liked the vibe. The staff is friendly! The guy at the register (didn't get his name, he's buff and has a sleeve-tattoos) has great customer service. I ordered the vegan bowl & it came out within less than 10 minutes of sitting down. When the food was brought to my table, I was astonished by how beautiful, fresh, & appetizing it looked. I knew I had to write a review expressing my appreciation of the quality of the food I paid for. I will absolutely be a returning customer & recommend this place to everyone. The food was so delicious, I didn't even stop to think about how healthy it is. Thank you!

---Rant---

If I could give this place **more than 5 stars***, I would~

Service-wise, I got a pretty good description of the food from a few different servers/staff.  In fact, the first time I was ordering their Peanut Butter Dream (protein shake) and asked for 3 extra scoops, the huge guy behind the counter (who I assume is also the owner) said "no you don't want that because each scoop is 25 grams of protein, so that plus the peanut butter and the egg white..."  I was totally stoked when he said that because most places like Jamba Juice and such give you a measly 10 grams of protein per scoop, which is total weaksauce!  Protein House gives you a whopping 25 grams of whey protein per scoop as well as different flavors!  EXCELLENT~

So over the course of a 7 day climbing trip, I ate here 5 days, mostly for dinner.  Tried the PH Hash, a DOUBLE Bison burger, their Quinoa Bowl, all of which were amazing, tasty, and most importantly for me, LOADED with protein!

Bodybuilding must be big in Vegas because the walls were plastered with signed autographs of some seriously hot IFBB Figure Competitors like Larissa Reis (actually there was A LOT of Larissa Reis all over the wall, and understandably so.  She's hot~).

My only negative comment is that there isn't one of these in California!!! I guarantee people in Newport Beach would pay more than what they charge in Henderson for this kind of quality and type of food!

Rock Climbing is like ALL DAY strength training/power lifting for your back/biceps/forearms.  Protein House gives me exactly what I need to recover from a long day of hard bouldering and class 3/class 4 hiking. I HIGHLY recommend this place if you want a great tasting, generously portioned, high protein meal for a reasonable price.


---Overall---

Service: A, stellar

Food: A+, amazing food, high quality

Atmosphere: A+, Larissa Reis...'nuff said.

The Protein House is a favorite. They use simple REAL food and prepare tasty meals that leave you satisfied and feeling good about your choices. Favorites are the "Sexy Bitch" bowl, Teriyaki Bowl, SHRDD Omelette, and PH Hash (who knew bison was so good!). In fact, everything I've tried has been great. As a personal note, the availability of multiple gluten-free choices is really appreciated.

The counter help and food preparation team are very courteous and more than willing to personalize your order as needed. Allow some time for food preparation because they make up each order fresh, but the minimal extra wait is definitely worth it.

This place is disgusting. Food sucks, overpriced, service is mediocre, and it's such a wannabe health spot. Don't be fooled by the photos in the walls. You wanna eat healthy? Go to the grocery store and buy yourself some fresh chicken, spinach, and any other green veggies that you like, then season with light olive oil and salt. You'll eat way healthier and save money while you're at it. Stop being lazy, go to the grocery store!!!
This place is epic! Clean nice and comfortable. The food is great and healthy! Come here and enjoy.

This was the second time going to this establishment and I thought it would be a better experience than the first, yet many ways it was worse. 
We had a fairly simple order, no changes to the menu descriptions by additions or substitutions. The girl last night was almost rude. She seemed as though we were interrupting her by placing our order!!! I am sorry that my purchases are paying for you to have a job young lady... is how I felt!!! 
There are advertisements that specifically state they use Illy coffee. So I proceeded to order one for my aunt who only drinks this particular brand. The staff member told me they were out. I stated ok, but you advertise you sell Illy coffee. She said, that she would have to make more and that it takes a while so I would have to wait (with a attitude mind you). I stated that was fine and I just wanted a cup of coffee. After much hesitation and a bit of attitude she made a cup. Upon arriving back at the hospital with our food and the coffee...
The coffee was not Illy!!!! It was bitter and acidic, nothing like Illy brand. The bowl we ordered was so spicy it was almost too spicy to eat and I grew up with spicy. So I have no idea what they did to this bowl. 
I won't be returning... I feel that overall the food is overpriced and the staff is extremely rude. I won't be going back and warn others to take precautions.

With $4.00 cookies and 6" $12.00 wraps the PH house should be nominated for "MOST RIDICULOUSLY PRICED CASUAL DINING FOOD".  Sorry.  I WANTED desperately, to like the PH but with the Jo√´l Robuchon prices in the Chipotle-esque dining accommodations, it was impossible for me regardless of how delicious and nutritious the food was. I wish I could give this place a hearty thumbs up and WILL once they either upgrade their dining experience or lower their prices, but until then...sorry Larissa

Tried this place for the first time and absolutely loved it!!!! Ordered a Greek bowl with brown rice and a side of jalape√±os because I love spice- totally hit the spot. The portion was just right  and the atmosphere is clean also friendly staff. It's a little pricey but you are getting a healthy meal option which I can appreciate. Will definitely be coming back soon.

Outstanding service specially to the guy that delivers my food.ask me if im ok and if i need amything .said im ok .. Food was great price a little high but it is what it is.. I would recomend and eat here again with my gym buddies and my wife. Good job

My sister and I went here after a workout at LVAC. While the food was great (I had the greek bowl), the atmosphere could definitely use some help. Not sure why there were so many pictures of the same woman in the windows? You're not selling a nutritional supplement, you're selling food, showcase that instead. Overall, great experience. We will definitely be returning.
Excellent hot and fresh food, smoothies and covers all types of pallets even my 9 year old loves it!  Try the quesadilla and the PB&J smoothie!

Awful customer service! We walked in and we were the only ones there. We placed our for here order and sat down. They gave us a number for our table so they knew the order was for here and not to go. Another guy came in after us, he placed his order and got it after 20 mins and left. 

We've now sat here for 30 mins. We are again the ONLY people in the place with 4 employees. The employees are now cleaning the grill.  I get up and ask if they are making our order. The guy tells me there is no order to make. The girl who took my order is two feet away and said "oh here's your order. He made it to go". So she hands me my cold food. No apologies. 

We sat here for 30 mins and with no other customers and no one thought 1) what are they waiting for? 2) who does this to go order belong to?

Food was pretty bad too. Go to Greens & Protiens for good food, good service.

Why so serious...I thought as I looked around at the staff on a slow Saturday afternoon. I was going to place my purse on the floor near my chair as I waited for my "fresh"  made-to-order Super Power juice but stopped when I saw stickiness on the floor. The glass table was just as grungy. Hoping the juice would make up for the sloppy table area, I waited...a long time. 

I sipped and wanted to spit it out. It tasted spoiled! I juice at home frequently with a Vita Mix and now a Ninja. I know these flavor profiles very well and like them a lot when they are made fresh. I couldn't believe my taste-buds. How could fresh juice taste spoiled? I did something I rarely do. I went back to complain. The lady smiled and offered me another type. I tried the Detox, substituted cucumbers for celery. Although this one didn't have the Blah factor of the first one, I threw it out anyways because it tasted old. 

When she was preparing my second juice the mystery of spoiled juice was revealed. This IS NOT FRESH JUICE. They have plastic containers in the fridge where they pour out OLD juice made in the morning, (the way my first juice  tasted SPOILED, I doubt its all made in the morning. You don't have room for fresh veggies? ( That's what I was told), what else don't you have room for? Now I get why the staff looked so serious. I hope the owners fix this soon. Paying 6.99 for stale juice is fraudulent when people are thinking they are getting fresh juice.

Owner Larissa Reis has created the perfect healthy eating establishment.  Not only is everything they sell very healthy; it all tastes delicious. And they'll customize any meal to your specific requirements. 

I love the ahi tuna salad; the salmon bowl with quinoa: and the ahi tune burger on Ezekiel bread with grilled sweet potato strips. I'm getting hungry just thinking of all the great dishes at Protein House!

I've given Protein House a handful of chances, but each time I'm left very underwhelmed. They are consistently very slow. The cashier has little to no personality, and usually makes me feel like I'm burdening them in having them do their job. And perhaps this is just me, but I figure a restaurant that is solely focused on being health conscious would be more accommodating to special requests.

I grabbed an early dinner here and walked in already knowing full-on what I wanted. I ordered a PH Chopped salad with the dressing and cheese on the side, to-go. I had to repeat exactly what I wanted 3 times as the cashier was disinterested, hardly looked up at me, and couldn't crack a smile if her life depended on it. Eventually she repeated back to me exactly what I wanted, asked me what temperature for the steak (I ordered medium-rare), and then offered me a cup for water while I wait which was a nice touch.

20 something minutes later, they are finally calling my name with my to-go order, which they shouted 3 times as apparently I am not fast enough moving from the table to their counter as they would've liked. Hey, I waited 20 minutes for this bad-boy, give me and my sore legs a chance to react, would ya?

While walking out, I did a quick check in the bag, noticed the dressing nicely packed on its own, and no utensils. Scanning the front for any plasticware, I saw none. I figured I could hold off until I'm at a friend's before eating, so I didn't sweat it. 

Finally getting down to eat my meal, I took one bite and realized they hadn't packaged the cheese on the side at all. It was crumbled and viciously mixed in with the rest of the salad. Now to be honest with you, I probably should have told them to hold off on the cheese altogether. It's not that I don't like blue cheese (I love it), but it's just not on the menu for me right now. You'd think a restaurant catered to dieters would be more careful...

The steak was cooked to medium, which was actually a pleasant surprise as last time I ordered medium-rare they decided to obliterate the crap out of it until it was a nice, grey, chewy mess. But maybe next time if they don't overcook it, I won't have to wait 25 minutes for a salad. I could have gone to Cafe Zupas and gotten the same salad, done correctly, and for a fraction of the cost. Sad for a health conscious restaurant. I would not recommend. Greens & Proteins is the only way to go in the area.

After so many trips to Vegas, my buddies and I decide to head out and eat something healthy, after this week of overindulgence. With it being the anniversary of Protein House, we figured that it was about time. As you enter the establishment, you can tell that its not kept up very well. The cashiers was kind of nice, but I couldn't tell since she never smiled. There was one petit girl who was busing all the tables, and she was the reason I left the tips, since she was having to tend to all this solo. Ordered the Muscle Builder, and BBQ turkey Burger, with mashed sweet potatoes and sweet potato pieces... It might be healthy, but you can definitely be more creative in making food taste better. I never went back for the water, because that dispenser was filthy. I'm not talking about just a little splash back, but hard water stains, and other colored spots. Mind you, this only dispenses water and ice, so there's no explanation for the other stains. The water in the catch can was overflowing, with things in it. I never went for water, so that I could keep my meal down. The 2nd star was for the 10% check-in offer, but I gave that money back in tips. I might've just not tipped at all, if I knew you had to get your own food at the serving station. 

On a side note... The clientele and some staff must've been on a low carb week or something. The vibe in that place when stepping in, eating, and exiting had a very strong air of "douchiness".
