Call me crazy, but I like to eat good food, in a clean and happy environment. Even with good looking physiques, there was a lot of overcompensating from the men and women in there. Not sure I'd be back, because of all these factors. You can find comparable food, for the same or less.
We love this place every time we come in from Chicago my husband and I look forward to  protein house for clean healthy food with good service this place is always that

Located in the old Illy Espresso place, next to Grimaldi's, this place is perfect for a quick healthy bite--breakfast, lunch, or dinner.  I came around brunch time on a weekday.  Patrons consisted of alotta gym folk and lunch break goers, but it wasn't crazy busy so it was a good place for me to get some work done (free wifi, plus a couple of outlets for electronics--yay!).  

I really like their bowls.  Fresh in quality and flavor.  I made my own bowl which consisted of steak, red onions, tomatoes, mushroom, cilantro, and feta over quinoa with a side of cilantro-lime vinaigrette.  It came out to about $14--not bad considering the quality of the food.  I also tried the lolo bowl (~$8), which was chocolate/peanut butter whey concoction, topped with granola, honey, strawberries, and bananas.  The foods really filling, and I had leftovers for another meal.  

Service wasn't bad.  They serve things up on real plates and clean up after you when you leave.  The place is really well-kept and clean--including the bathrooms.  The back walls and bathroom are decorated with a bunch of pictures of fitness folk--bulging muscles and all--not my cup of tea, but I don't mind it.  They also have a huge TV for patrons to catch the latest sports highlights.

Overall, a good healthy option to try.

workout much?

i finally went to this place after hearing so many of my gym friends talk about it! upon walking in, everything is nice and sleek, clean and full of gym style music! some of the menu is on the wall and there is paper menu too! my friend got a protein bowl and i got a teriyaki protein chicken burger sans the bun and i must say, it was delicious! the chicken was nice and juicy, the pineapple was just sweet enough and the amount of teriyaki sauce on the burger was just right!

i loved that they have the macros of the meal on the side and you can add either veggies or sweet potatoes to your meal as well. they have a vast array of smoothies as well, so if you're on the run, you can grab a pretty large sized protein shake to go! 

they have a nice breakfast menu as well that included eggs, waffles and scrambles that look good, so next time i get out of the gym early, this is going to be a pit stop before home! all in all, this is an extremely good place for health conscious people or people who are trying to get fit!

AWESOME SERVICE!
Delicious Greek bowl with quinoa and egg white add!
Was starving  and now I am fully satiated! 
Dam I love good food  and great service! 


Here's the only deal this is a Greek bowl- they add black olives, that are non-Greek, I go down to Go Raw Cafe and I buy their delicious sundried olives and I add them to this bowl for that tangy taste I like... The olives from Go Raw are not Kalmata olives, however they taste it... 
Yum, I do love creating food porn so so so much.

Love the protein house. I eat there frequently as I work nearby. The people there are always great and the food is tasty. I love the fact that you can smell them grilling all that great steak and meat. 

you can mix and match bowls of different meats with different veggies. They have a great breakfast menu as well. If you like meat and veggies, you'll love Protein House. They have everything from lean steaks to bison to fish. Great healthy meal with some flavor!

This is my favorite place to go for a meal post workout or anytime when I'm craving meals that are conducive to a healthy lifestyle. My favorite thing on the menu so far is the "PH burger". It's a bison meat burger with an incredibly fresh wheat bun.

The environment is relaxed with an upbeat vibe. EDM is typically playing throughout the day, which keeps the atmosphere young. The restaurant itself is clean and well maintained by a staff, and the owners, who care about food, fitness and their customers. 

No complaints about this place other than the chairs being a little squeaky ;)
Whenever we are in Vegas this is where we come to grab a healthy bite to eat. If you like smoothies you should definitely try the green beast.

I had really high expectations for this place! The place its self is pretty cool i like all the pictures they got up on the walls & and the massive tv. i got the Aloha Burger with sweet potatoes on the side. The burger was a bit dry the chicken was a bit over cooked in my opinion. I also think its a bit pricy. Idk maybe next time ill have a better experience!

Checked this place out approximately 2 months ago. I was desperate for coffee after leaving my appointment (in the same building) . I got a medium ice black coffee and it cost me $3ish ! and it wasn't that great. Like it was my crappy work coffee that I pay for 10 cents. Also they weren't so friendly. Not much smiles. Didn't get any hellos. I guess if I'm in the mood ill try it again.

I really enjoy eating at 'the protein house'.  My husband and I go here regularly after working out.  The skinny bitch bowl is extremely tasty, as is everything else I have tried.  The only reason I am not giving them 5 stars is because there is no nutritional information posted.  I keep track of everything I eat and drink and would like to be able to be more precise when it comes to my Macro intake.  Otherwise great food!

The cashier was a BITCH!!!! She wasn't helpful at all I don't think she even has attempted to work out in her life!!! She kept interrupting me when I was trying to ask questions!! So I just gave up.... If your going to have someone who's a cashier least make sure they can help she was rude and didn't know anything!!! 

They leave food on the tables for an extremely long time with out cleaning it

But the food is yummy so I would come back but I won't eat here to go for sure
They cater towards people that workout and like to know what they're eating.  Yet, no nutrition information posted anywhere.  Get it together.

I felt like I had just walked into the free weight area of Gold's Gym or stepped onto the Jersey Shore, lots of steroids and meatheads. 

Kinda went here on a whim, wanted something healthy and wanted to try somewhere besides Greens & Proteins. It was both my friend and my first time here, the girl at the counter didn't seem interested in offering any suggestions or helping us. I decided to try the Greek Signature Bowl, turkey burger, tomato, black olives, feta, cucumber and red onion, and I chose quinoa for the carb. This was really lacking in flavor and for $9.99 I was really disappointed. I also didn't like that they didn't have the nutritional value available.

They don't sell soda or have a soda machine, yet they sell Crystal Lite and have 10+ sugar free syrups behind the counter, artificial sugar is just as bad as soda. 

I don't see myself returning. If I'm going to spend the money I'd rather go to Greens & Proteins.

I ordered myself a meal, protein cookies and meal prep fro the week. Customizing my meals and putting in an order for about 15 mins. Then to come to find out they don't accept debit cards that swipe (only chipped).  I'm kind of Frustrated because there was no sign or did I get any kind of warning about them not accepting debit cards. Wasted a good amount of time. I asked for the managers number and they said they do not have a number or could give me a business card, email or anything to contact manager. I'm a regular here and very shocked how poorly I was getting treated. Not professional and dropped my rating from a 5 to a 1 :(

Drum roll for a healthy Resteraunt.........
(Insert imaginary music here!) 
Wait for it.......!!!!!!!!!!!! 
PERFECTION! 

This place is amazing! I know, most people who are weird health freaks say "wheat grass is some delish" and " I love almond meal cookies!" But do you believe them? Not at all. But no joke this place doesn't lack luster in any of the food items on the menu! Seasoning is all there to tantilize your tastebuds! Now im a Paleo, zone, eat right freak who cheats once a week to feel like I don't send my mind to the imaginary food gauntonimo bay! 

But the food is amazing. I had a general bowl and a monster green juice. It was so well balanced and filling! My bison was cooked perfect! I even had to fulfil my sweet tooth and pick up some homemade protein balls! Needless to say I ate those before you could ask to taste one! 
I do croasfit, I'm crazy, but I'm Italian and I cater so I know food food! This is GOOD HEALTHY LIVING FOOD FOR AN AMAZING PRICE!
Be healthy and get fit without compromising flavor! Check this place out! You won't be disappointed
My absolute favorite place to hit up after the gym! The Acai Nutty Butter bowl but as a vegan smoothie is a must have!

This place is bomb. The food was good the service was great and fast. It's very casual. You'll be fin in gym attire. Price is worth it the servings were huge and you feel like you get your fill. This was with serving from so cal for. I'll be back again soon

Finally had a chance to visit this place.
I had Southwest bowl with half brown rice and half quinoa.
The beef was so tasty. I'm sure it wasn't filet mignon or anything like that, but it was so tender and lean tasted just like filet mignon. 
Their black bean salsa tasted delicious with the meat and brown rice. It was not spicy at all. 
Nice to have healthy cafe like this in my neighborhood.
They offer meal prep, too!! Download their app and get 11th bowl for free!!

I love this place so much. It's clean, they have great staff, they have a digital menu with photos and a paper menu. Every single item on the menu is healthy and clean eating. You have options of vegetables for your sides. You have different protein meat options. You can even choose how much protein or sides you want. For instance, 9oz. of bison, 1 cup of brown rice. If you're on meal prepping, this place is even more perfect. You can many anything work for your macro intake. Most importantly, you can place your meal prep orders here. They have a meal prep menu. You can customized your meals and they actually measure your food properly so you don't go over or below you macro intake. Everything on the menu from breakfast, to smoothies, bowls, salads, proteins shakes, coffee, cookies, brownies, lunch and dinners is simply PERFECT! Seriously!!!! If you want to eat or need the protein intake, this place is for you. They make protein pancakes with protein syrup, coffee protein shakes. My favorite is "Vanilla Gorilla". This place is for everyone. I take my entire family here and mg kids love it here too. They love the protein pancakes, the protein brownies, the steak and much more. They also carry meal prep bags large and small with containers inside of them plays the ice packs to freeze. They also have workout gear for both male and females and hats. They have sale what you need for before, after, or during gym sessions. They have protein shaker cups, water bottles, all kinds of fitness drinks and even coconut water. They great natural juices with BCAAs and natural teas. The water they serve isn't like other restaurants. There water actually tastes good and clean too. I can keep going. This is Olaf was sooooo perfect, I would love to o w day be a franchise PH owner. I love a healthy lifestyle and this restaurant is just perfect for my lifestyle and it can be perfect for you too. Please try this place at least once. You won't regret it. One more thing, they now do catering. What more can you ask for? and all of their ingredients are fresh too. Another new thing they have now are healthy shots. For example, ginger tumeric etc. Shots. Literally everything they offer is healthy for you and your entire family.

Pricing is a bit high. Customer service is great. Clean place and liking the vibe as we walk in. Pictures of trainers all over the walls,  food took a little long to prepare but then again this aint a fast food joint, but food is awesomely to die for.  The sexy bitch bowl is delicious!

I had an amazing meal yesterday on my vacation to Las Vegas at protein house. The muscle freak smoothie and several of there meals were amazing. The salmon and quinoa dish is there best thanks for the experience.
SUCH FRIENDLY STAFF AND SO, SO DELICIOUS! Please open a location closer to Summerlin! Although I will definitely hit this place every time I am on it's side of town!

I was not impressed by this place at all. I love seeing restaurants with a sort of healthy theme but this place is skippable. 

I came in late one evening and ordered a veggie and rice bowl. The restaurant was not busy and yet it was a mess. Where I stood to order my food you can see the kitchen area and there was food every where on the floor. If it were busy, it would be understandable. 

After ordering, I sat down to wait for my order to get made and realized that one table was customers and another was employees and friends of theirs. The dining area had boxes, papers and junk all over the place. The floor was dirty and so were most of the tables. This annoyed me because it seemed they were almost over staffed and yet it was a huge mess in the place. They did chose to make the restaurant mostly white so I am sure this is why the mess stands out so much. 

They had music playing and it was that music you would hear in a 'pump you up' cycling class. It was way too loud! I asked for a to go box and felt like we need to shout to hear each other. Too much. Who wants to eat with harsh base beats pulsing in their ears? That can not be healthy. 

I ordered the veggie bowl with brown rice. It was decent but, I would not go out of my way to come back here. I do not remember if it seemed over priced or anything but the experience as a whole was 'meh'.

If I heard that things improved at this place I might give it another go but for now I will be passing.

tldr

Kinda expensive for what is it; I wished the price point was a bit lower everything is $10+.
The food was good, well cooked and tasty though.
Also expected more chicken (protein) in the bowl.

Get:
-BBQ chicken bowl with brown rice

This place is amazing! My friend told me about this place and since Im here in Vegas, I decided to check it out. The food is delicious. Since I usually do compeitions, I like to keep a clean diet and this place helps me stay on track. Customer service is great. The wait time wasn't bad either. I got my food pretty quick. Very clean restaurant as well. I would definitely tell my friends to go here.

Service was good, food was great. Good size portions. Lots of options and they offer breakfast too which is always a plus. I really wish they listed calorie contents, or nutritional info. Other than that,  my only complaint would be that it's a little pricey.
The workers are nice but the food took forever to come out and people who ordered after us got their food before we did.

Probably one of my favorite spots to go to right now for clean eating. I'm new to the area and ran into this spot based off recommendations from relatives who try to eat clean, as well. I enjoy the fact that their sweets are made with Stevia. 

The Bison burgers with a side salad are super good. I usually have the Hulk as a drink which is also pretty yummy.

Look forward to coming back to try more.

I hope that they do venture out and use more coconut or MCT oil to fry anything; eggs, fries and etc. 

Future is bright for this place and am happy to support it when I can.

I just want to say what great customer service I received.  It was so great to ask the employees about the food and they were able to answer my questions.  I tried for the first time a bison burger and it was delicious. I will be back to try other stuff on the menu.

Today I took my friend to this restaurant based of of recommendations from friends. We specifically let the person who was waiting on us know that my friend has allergies. Specifically "Peanuts" !!! 
We were told that that was okay because they will not include anything with nuts on her meal.
That's not TRUE!!! They used a nut based seasoning on her "Mediterranean  Wrap"! She had an instant reaction when we got home and she took a bite. We rushed to the hospital and luckily we live close by.

If you're serving food shouldn't you need to know what ingredients you are serving. I'm absolutely infuriated with this type of service. You are playing with people's lives. Your employees should listen to their customers instead of assuming. A business like yours show list that you use nuts or any other commonly known ingredients that may cause allergic reactions...

Your employees need to be trained on how incorporate safety for its customers. We are not just $$ money coming into your doors!

All talk no walk.

After this places was hyped up to me and my bodybuilder by another close gym buddy, we came here to eat after the Olympia Expo.  The concept for this place is great and I fully understand the clientele they are marketing to.  So here is the break down:

The lack of communication between back and front of house is out of this world.  You're out of product and you don't let anyone know?   In fact you let customers order and only inform them once they send food back.  If you ask for anything to be different on your entree, you will not receive it, or you will receive what they want you to have.  

Attention to tickets and menu items was a miss for our group as well.  Main ingredients missing for 2 of our 4 entrees, extras not received upon delivery of our food.

Customer service was strange as well.  The Co-owner was friendly when he took our orders and was happy to add additional items to my bowl and other adjustments to 2 other orders. I saw the other owner Jill running around and doing an excellent job. The two of them get an A+.  However the thick girl with the hipster glasses doesn't have a clue what she is doing other than bringing food to a table.  When confronted about the incorrect orders the response was "um...so....um ok well I guess, what do you need?  let me see if we can do that"  this alone blew my mind.  I work in the hospitality industry and server when I have to, this is never a response you should give a customer.  Maybe more training is needed with line staff and servers.....it can only help.

The food was ok otherwise.  I'm not use to food that is so under seasoned.  A little cumin or pepper never hurt anyone.  I get the salt and holding water aspect so salt isn't a big deal.

I would like to give this place another try though.  Everyone has an off night.

- Cara

This is my second time here I wanted to give the a second chance after the depressing bison burger I had the first time. Today I ordered the Ninja a sandwich on a wheat burger bun with Tuna, egg, avocado, tomato, onion, and some pretty good sauce mixture. 
I must say it was better than my first experience. They have a extensive menu  breakfast items are included along with any smoothie or shake you desire. The staff seems rather snotty maybe I'm not yoked enough to eat here yet. I am by the way the least muscular patron in here. 
All in all a good experience. 

Thank you all for taking time to read my reviews.

Do you even snack bro?

This is literally a heavy weightlifter's wet dream, from the decor, the gym thumping techno music and the extensive protein packed menu. I was expecting something different when I walked in, but was pleasantly surprised to see clean white lines and sleek look of the room. 

The menu sort resembles an Instagram meal plan page and a weight trainer's cookbook, just the basic needs. Which does makes sense because the owner is an IG famous fitness trainer and can most likely kick your ass; as one her hobbies is UFC training. I went with the Thai Monster Bowl; chicken, lean top sirloin, broccoli, asparagus, green onions and a Thai peanut sauce on top. This was delicious and flavor packed, all the veggies were steamed and the protein grilled, there was literally no oils on anything and just lightly seasoned. 

This bowl was a lot deeper than it looked and filled me for a good chunk of the day without feeling like I was stuffed and bloated. Seriously, this place is surprisingly good and definitely worth checking out. They also offer a decent assortment of protein shakes and espresso. yeah, espresso. Cray. 

Pump up that meal plan brosef!

Protein house is my go to spot when I'm looking for a guilt free, delicious meal.  Almost everything on the menu that I have tried is amazing.  

My person favorites are the PH breakfast wrap (sub out bison for the chicken) and the southwest bowl.  Everything here is freshly cooked, the staff is always prompt and friendly, atmosphere is upbeat and very clean, and of course, the food is amazing.  

The protein froyo and healthy treats are all delicious.  Located only a couple of minutes off of the 215 freeway, I highly recommend stopping by

Pretty disappointing. 

Ordered the veggie burger with no onions and a side salad. Asked if the veggie burger was a vegan, the girl working the register said she didn't know. I asked if she could please find out... She looked annoyed. 

When the food arrived at the table my burger had onion on it and my side salad was covered in cheese and dressing. Granted, I didn't confirm that the salad was vegan, but typically if you order a vegan item staff will think to mention it. I sent the salad back (not the burger) and also asked the waiter if the dressing was vegan. He said he didn't know. I asked if he could please find out... He looked annoyed. 

The food was okay, but there are just too many great places close by that are better and more reasonably priced (Lyfe Kitchen, Green &Proteins). Probably won't be returning to Protein House.

Was really excited when they opened up. There are limited healthy options in this side of town as we have way too many chain and fast food establishments. Had high hopes for this spot. Tried it last night and was disappointed. 

Ordered two Italian Stallion salads. Two salads are quite pricy ($12 each) and came to just over $25. For that price we expected great salads. To our shock the salads were TEENY tiny. After leaving a tip, paying almost $30 - we were given two salads that we both finished in about three bites. The chicken portion was very small and laughable. The "dressing" was clumpy and looked "off" (we used our own vinaigrette). If I was to guess I would also assume these salads were not made fresh and prepackaged, as the lettuce was wilting and soft, had some brown edges and asparagus was soggy? 

Hard to mess up a salad but somehow they managed it. Felt slighted for the amount spent. Next time I want a good salad I will go to Cafe RIO next door and save $$$. 

Going to wait some time and give PH some time to make improvements to their menu and operations before I return. It's a great concept, just need to step up quality and adjust prices slightly to better reflect the area. Have seen way too many places come and go in that immediate area. Hope they can make it!

I stopped in for a smoothie and a bite to eat since I was in the neighborhood. My green drink and vegetarian bowl were tasty. The place has modern decor.There is an open kitchen so you can see what is happening while it is happening. Plenty of staff to help get your order out quickly. I would like to see the menu expand a bit to compete with other healthy choices like Greens and Proteins.

This is a good place to get healthy food and juices/smoothies. The prices are pretty fair and you just have to know you're getting "gym junkie food." That means it's lean and sometimes lacking flavor but healthy. I've been here tons during my work trips out there and each time I get something different to explore the menu. While the food is great I usually leave wanting a little more of something.. but I have a good experience overall. The juices are good and the salads are great. Low carb, low sugar, low fat, high protein is the name of the game here. Nice staff. And if you check in on Yelp you get 10% off your entire order.

Not really a big fan of this place, but I decided to give it another shot. Once again I was disappointed! They took 1 hour to make my food!!!!!! Are you kidding me!!! And when I go and tell the chef to make my food to go, rather than offering me at least a dam brownie for waiting so dam long, he just says "it's almost ready" , like are you kidding me? Totally regret going there, next time I'm going down the street to greens and proteins where they're quick, friendly and the food is delicious!

The food is tasty and healthful.  It is a little pricey but for fresh and healthy, it's worth it.  I had the salad with grilled salmon.  The dressing was so good I learned how to make it and use it all the time - balsamic agave. Yum.

Who would have thought Las Vegas would offer so many super healthy options when it's time to eat?  This trip we checked out Protein House.  Wow, this place is awesome.  Great variety of interesting, delicious sounding healthy things on the menu so deciding was a challenge.  I opted for the Vegan wrap and man was it good.  Super fresh ingredients, lots of flavor and holy cow am I full.  Great place for you to eat whether a mean eater or a vegetarian.  5 of us ordered a variety of things and were so pleased we had to stop for breakfast again on our way out of town.  We NEED one of these in South Orange County!
I eat here or take out often.... It's delicious, fresh, made-to-order healthy food in a great atmosphere!!! What more could you ask! I recommend the Greek bowl.... It's my favorite!

Ditto. I used to like coming here - I had not been here for a while because it's a ways from home and work. Since I was nearby and my new gym is right across the street I was starving and was excited to fuel here. Sadly, I concur...customer service sucks! Cashier had no personality, didn't feel welcoming at all. I waited 30 min for my juice! It was an hour before closing after a workout, they were slow and 3-4 customers after me got served before I did. And they ordered food! It was near closing and I finally asked the other employee where my drink was. She was apologetic and the one who helped me didn't even bother to apologize. I'll stick to Greens and Proteins for better service, better food and ambience! The folks at Circle K have better attitude and service!

Wow! Awesome staff, great food and it's healthy. The convenience of having such a great alternative to fast food is welcoming. Presentation of the meals is done in an informal and creative way. Special requests are no problem. Protien House goes over and above making me feel like I'm special. Definitely my guilty pleasure are the pancakes...yes pancakes! All healthy, natural and delicious. Would give 5 stars + if I could!

The food was good, nothing special that sets them apart though. I'd go again, but not if it's out of my way. Nice atmosphere, the visuals of extremely buff women everywhere is a little off putting. We get it.

I asked the girl that took my order the nutrition facts for the protein brownie and she had no idea. For a place that is run by a bodybuilder I thought there would be nutritional information available for each dish. We ordered Larissa's Thai monster bowl and the signature teriyaki bowl.

Thai monster bowl- chicken was slightly raw; lacked seasoning; peanut butter lovers will like the spicy peanut sauce

Teriyaki bowl- teriyaki sauce? The teriyaki sauce here is orange in color and if I was blind folded I never would have guessed it was teriyaki sauce 

I forgot to use the 10% check in deal so Larissa gave me a chocolate protein brownie instead. I wanted to try the chocolate brownie in the beginning but for $4 and the size I didn't see the value. The brownie ended up being the best thing I tasted here. It was very moist but I was hoping to know the nutrition facts. 

I will be back if I'm in the area and in need of healthy food. However, I will not go out of my way because of the lack of nutrition information; high prices; sauces not tasting the way they are described.

Meh, I got a bison bowl with asparagus, brocoli, and red peppers. For $14 thats a rip. It was a decent portion, (perfect for a lunch) but price should have been about $9. This place is way over priced. The only reason my food was good was because I soaked it in sriracha hot sauce. I wouldn't recommend it. The ratings prove its quality. Should have listened to my fellow yelpers and just went to the gas station and bought a bag of beef jerky, would have been more satisfied...
Please change your menu ingredients before you guys serve it. I'm allergic to tofu and southwest veggie burger said it was QUINOA patty not tofu!!!!

Rude! I don't spend my money anywhere I don't feel welcomed. Walked in, there was only one gentleman sitting and a staff of 5 behind the bar not one person greeted me. The girls were just chatting with each other and continued. Another guy came in for a pickup and he too was left to wait while they continued to gossip until he could finally get a word in and ask for his order. Sorry but bad service means no money from me! I walked out. This is Vegas, there are other places to eat.
A Bit expensive and didnt have much flavor compared to other healthy food places i have been to.

I want to say don't come here it's over price you are better off going to whole foods it takes forever to get your order and also my food was over cooked and my smoothie was not good I tried this place 3 times I tried to like it but third time I'm out

Yummy!  I'm on a health food trip and what better place to eat than a place called Protein House!  My steak salad was very yummy!  Lots of selections to try.  I will definitely be a returning  customer.
The food was okay, small portions for the price.  Pricey and could use a bit more flavor.  Service needs improvement.
Def. a go to when I'm on this side of town. In love with the Salmon salad. Always fresh food!! Wish they had more locations!!

Love coming to Protein House after a bball game for a smoothie or for a healthy lunch. Usually go with a berry berry blast smoothie. As far as food you can't mis, everything they have is healthy. I usually go with the PH Chopped Cobb or a Teriyaki Bowl. Prices are a little high but its worth it for the quality of food. There are many things on the menu that I would like to try so I will definitely be making a trip back soon.
Love their protein shakes. Definitely a spot you should check out if you want to eat something healthy or clean. Haven't had their food but definitely plan to!
Kinda rude staff. No blueberries, no strawberries no coconut and no syrup on my PH loaded pancakes. The breakfast sandwich was good.

I have eaten there twice and the food was excellent. Lots of choices but not overwhelming.  Just pick your protein and it comes in various options, bowl, wrap burger. Etc.  Really good! You wont be disappointed.

This restaurant was excellent!  I don't normally eat at these types of restaurants and totally stepped out of my comfort zone and LOVED it.  I got the Southwest Bowl and it was wonderful.  The sauces they had were great as well.  I ordered my steak medium rare and it came out more of medium well so that was the only negative thing.

My friend got the veggie burger and said the patty was juicy and flavorful.  She also got one of the juices and it was so delicious!

The staff was very accommodating and polite.  I will definitely be back!

I love this place!

Their protein brownie is delicious (Although I wish they listed the ingredients on it so I would know if it is clean or not)

The protein shakes are fantastic! I've had a few of them and they are always delicious. 

It's a little expensive (comes to about $7 a protein shake or more) but worth it.

Great food and service-
They're happy to accommodate any special requests or subs you may have and the place is always looking clean. My favorites are the Peanut Butter Dream smoothie and the Boss bowl. Great quality of the ingredients and it all feels very fresh. This place is a great healthy alternative to other places, especially for gym goers. However, the items are pretty pricey and the costs can add up quickly. If budget isn't an issue, then definitely give it a try.

I've yet to try something that isn't delicious and best of all, flavorful. Is it weird that I feel like this food is sinful? So good!!

The concept is great. Sure, waiting for your food might not be as quick as other quick food spots -- but this is fresh, made to order food. Appreciate the quality!

I'll be here more often

I give this place 10/10! excellent service, clean food, tastes amazing and is guilt free! One of the managers came by and gladly corrected my side dish for free. The bison PH burger is my go-to. The brownies and shakes are also a very yummy treat. Always come here when I go to vegas. Worth the drive from the strip for a good healthy, filling meal.

Walking into this place is absolutely by far the best I've ever been and tasted. You have endless options of different healthy meals and smoothies/juices. Everything looks properly organized as well as the staff being courteous and friendly. Food tastes AMAZING! I will definitely return again!

I cannot rave enough about this place. I live in California and drove to Vegas for a 3 day weekend. We drove straight to PH to eat lunch (we ordered the PH chopped) it was sooo good! The next morning drove from the strip back to PH, I  had the PB & J Protein pancakes. Umm still craving them today! My mom ordered the loaded oatmeal which she loved! Then our last day in Vegas we drove back to eat there one last time. I had the Froyo pancakes and my mom had the veggie omelet. If you have a chance to eat at any of their locations do it! You wont be sorry! Im so sad where I live we don't have one near us at all! Amazing food, even better prices, quality products !
We love it here!! Great spot for a smoothie, breakfast or lunch! Always fast and friendly service.

I'll keep this short and sweet. I had the Peanut Butter Smoothie and the Southwest bowl. The bowl was solid, the steak was cooked medium rare like I wanted and there was a lot of flavor to be had. I also really enjoyed the Smoothie, can't really go into greater detail on it because it's pretty straightforward, its a Peanut Butter Smoothie. I would definitely go back for the food. But I will say, it wouldn't be an every week type of place, the meals can be on the pricier side of things.
Awesome menu, fresh food and great flavor combinations. Also beats meal prepping at home. Just wish I had one closer to hometown.

Love this place. Clean eating and great smoothies. Try The Hulk smoothie. If I could go here every morning I would. They have a wide variety of foods for any palate. Larissa (owner) has done a great job!

If I'm gonna pay $13 for a "wrap" then I want a nice big fat wrap full of meat, not this thing. I sent it back and they were nice enough to remake it. One of the workers came over and asked if there was a problem and I told him the issue and he said they give 6oz of meat in each wrap. I'm no scientist but there is no 6oz of meat in this wrap. They remade the wrap and it was good, i love the peanut sauce there. I can dump that on anything. Not a horrible experience but for $13 please tell the chefs to put the right amount of protein in the wrap.

All day everyday when I'm in Vegas! I love this place. Everything from super healthy and delicious meal prep to yummy protein pancakes and bison burgers for cheat days. Everything on the menu is so tasty and fresh. Very reasonably priced for healthy food.

The first thing that comes to my mind when I think about Protein House is "When am I going back?" This place is not only delicious, but also suuuper healthy!! When I first looked at the menu I knew it was going to be a tough choice, and that I had to go back to try whatever I didn't pick. I ended up trying the Sexy Bitch Bowl. Good choice!! But I cannot wait to go there one day for breakfast: everything looks bomb!

First and most important is that I love that this place is so accommodating. While I struggle with having to follow a very restrictive diet this is one of the easiest places for me to order and not feel as though I'm being shorted on flavor. 
This place also works great for my boyfriend because he loves to double up the meat. Online ordering is super easy and my takeout orders have always been correct. For a while I always ordered the Sexy Bitch bowl, but lately I've been leaning more towards the Hardcoreis Bowl. I don't really understand the name, but since I'm not really a hard core worker-outer I'll assume it has something to do with that. Lol Also the fresh juices are great. The prices here are a little high, but the quality is good. Definitely recommend this place.

How could you pass by a place with a name like Protein House and not stop in? This place is a bodybuilding fuel mecca. For those looking to eat clean with macros, portion sizes, or protein intake in mind this place can cater to your needs.

Upon visiting I elected to go for the $14.99 Muscle Builder burger cooked medium rare. Two bison burger patties topped with cheddar cheese, caramelized onions, and a slice of Canadian bacon on a wheat bun with a side of sweet potato sticks. In one word, this thing was phenomenal! I've had bison before, but this was the best I'd ever had. It's crazy how something so good for your body could taste so good. Upon ingesting, I immediately felt the nutrients rush to all of my major muscle groups and felt them start to grow! Slight exaggeration there, I apologize.

When I had originally ordered my meal, the cashier turned her iPad screen around and it allowed me to input a pre-calculated tip. After I did so, she gave me my water cup and I filled it myself. When my food order was up, I had to get up and grab it myself. Not certain why a tip was necessary for that, but now at least I'll know for next time. Also, don't forget to check-in with the Yelp app and receive 10% off your entire order!

I love the Muscle Builder and I get it every time. It is a double bison burger. I get it medium, and the last time I had it, it was cooked to perfection. I have also had the PH Burger, the tropical acai bowl, and the protein pancakes. They are all amazing, and I tend to be quite particular about my food. I usually call in my order to avoid waiting 15 minutes for them to cook the burgers. Service is always very good.

aside from the amazing food and the healthy selections, i truly admire the surroundings.. which are the people who work there. Also the owner, whom I never once felt any negative vibes from him nor the people who work there. They all smile and are extremely courteous. Friendly atmosphere which is a lot of times the make it or break it in a business even if the food is excellent. When I come to Vegas, I stop by everyday after a great workout and it never fails on how good my experience is at every single visit. We will keep coming back whenever we are in town. Thank you for serving healthy food that caters to what most Americans are missing out on.

Perfect spot for lunch or after your workout! Great healthy items that will do you right! The protein shakes are killer never had a bad one before my favorite is the the vanilla gorilla. Extremely friendly staff and clean cut modern decor has you feeling like you're at the right place to getting fit! (Better than greens and proteins in my opinion) I would give this place 5 stars but I my honest opinion is the quality of meats could be a little bit higher, I understand that price is a huge factor but I do feel people would pay for higher quality meat if given the option to upgrade! All in all a go-to spot if you're in the area looking for a healthier option

Bad service.  The girls that are order takers weren't friendly.  No hello, thank you or have a Nice day.  So f'n rude.  
The chicken with quinoa that I ordered was bland, portions were small for the $15 I paid. 

This place is overpriced for the quality and service you get.  

Go to cafe Rio and get a chicken salad for $10 and it's good enough for 3 meals.   Plus their service is better and food taste delicious.

Great spot, especially for "clean eating". I ordered the protein bison burger medium rare which came out perfect. I think for those coming in here expecting a "traditional" burger spot experience, this place prob. is not for you in a sense that yes, it's more of a healthy alternative that still taste great. The only reason I did not give 5 stars was the service was not that great during my visit.

My new go to spot in vegas!

This place is awesome from the food to the customer service it was an awesome experience.

During a recent getaway myself and my girlfriend enjoyed an array of items on their menu.

Muscle boy breakfast = straight and forward everything was cooked my liking and delicious

thai monster w/ brown rice = delicious and highly curious on to whats in their peanut sauce marinade

steak breakfast burrito = best thing ever (keep in mind ive been on a chicken rice diet for the past few weeks so red meat was like crack at this moment) it was like the perfect helping of red meat and egg whites. 

gf had the salmon salad at that too was crazy flavorful and delicious.

we also tried a peanut butter protein smoothie = OH GOD (bigseanvoice) i seriously need to figure out how to make that thing.

While we were waiting the manager noticed our anxiousness and decided to have us try out some samples of a new smoothie they were working on. Its little aspects like this that really give an impression on the type of business theyre running. Even the busboys were nice to even see how our experience was when he picked up our plates. 

my only want would be a macro count on their menu cause im very curious to see the calorie count/macro ratios on some of their items.

I've been here a couple times mainly because I didn't feel like cooking my own protein meal/making a juice/shake. I've had their Teriyaki Bowl with quinoa and their Muscle Burger as a lettuce wrap. It actually looks like they've changed their menu since I've last been here... they don't have juices anymore but I've had a juice that was called like the Hang Over Cure or something... and some other juice that tasted a bit better than whatever was in the hang over one.

The Teriyaki bowl was okay. The salmon was a bit dry. The bowl could have used more sauce/flavor. I was really hungry when I was eating it and rushing over to a photo shoot though, so I wasn't exactly sitting and enjoying the meal, moreso shoveling it into my mouth.

The muscle burger as a lettuce wrap was impossible to eat as a lettuce wrap. I had to take my knife and fork to it. And there definitely wasn't enough lettuce or onions. Really just a ton of meat and cheese. And it definitely wasn't cooked medium. I only got this because the owner, at least I'm assuming the owner, recommended it. I barely put a dent into this monster when my stomach decided it wanted nothing more to do with it. I knew I should have asked for it without the cheddar cheese, but I didn't, and I literally couldn't function for the rest of the day. I'm assuming the cheese and resulting grease was the culprit as I've been on a really clean diet for a couple months already.  I took the rest home where I discarded the cheese. The meat ended up tasting pretty bland. The sweet potatoes were good though.

I haven't been a fan of the customer service. The girls at the counter always seem aloof, looking like the girls who get dolled up to go to the gym and act like they're better than you. The other workers who look like body builders just seem to keep to themselves. The only friendly interaction I've had with a worker was the guy who recommended the muscle burger to me.

The food and protein shakes are consistently delicious.  The floors, tables, and bathrooms are always clean. So what is the employees don't hold your hand every step of the way? I know how to read a menu and I don't need an overly-eager person to help me with my food.  I'm here at least 3 times a week and I haven't been disappointed yet. Carry on, Protein House,  you're doing great

Always good service and they add more options to the menu. 
This place always clean I go more often to get something to eat after dance class.

After the gym, Earl and I decided to pick up a smoothie at Protein House.  It was a very nice, clean.  Upon glancing at the blackboard, I don't see a list of juices so I inquired.  The not so friendly cashier said they only offer one juice, the Green Monster.  I chose Green Monster and Earl chose the Berry Blast Smoothie.  The ingredients used to make green monster includes spinach, coconut water, honey dew, pineapple, lime, ginger, cucumber, and kale.  Tasted like kale and spinach juice though.  There was no hint of sweetness from the fruits.

Earl's berry blast smoothie, which we could only taste whey protein.  Overall, glad we tried it, so we know to get something different next time.  I like to try a place thrice before writing it off, therefore, Meh for now.

This place is awesome!!! My husband had the double bison pattie burger and I had the salmon burger they were both fresh and delish!!!! Meat was cooked well had a great taste and the salmon was a very generous portion and cooked perfectly soft and perfectly cooked not over done at all.. Fresh wheat buns and yummy slices of avocado! I was impressed. Food was tasty yet very healthy. Perfect portion sizes. Also Ordered a green monster vegetable and fruit juice blend. I really liked it because it wasn't overly sweet. Overall great great experience and we will definitely be back!

When I'm in Las Vegas and I want a well crafted and nutritionally dense meal I always come here.  I'm the type of guy who's sweet tooth oftentimes gets him into trouble when dining out, at least here at Protein House I have some slack in my rope for when I fall.  

You HAVE to try their peanut butter balls with one of their signature coffees.  This is the cure for every social malady that exists in this universe.  

There may be 1000 ways to die, but for quality of life there's also 1000 ways to blend the flavors of lean proteins, fats, veggies, and whole grain carbs to perfection.  I recommend Protein House to all my friends.  Keep it up guys!


PS: PLEEEASE fix the "trip area" in front of the cash register.   :)
Great place. Super clean, food is on point and the staff is friendly. There are not many places in town where you can get an organization bizon burger. Food is super healthy and tastes like no other.

Really enjoyed my first visit to Protein House. It's hard to find a healthy balanced meal on the go but Protein House is the exception! 

First impressions - Wow! It felt nice and clean walking in! That's a huge plus!

Menu - Loved all the options but seemed a little hard to navigate. 

Can't wait to make this a go to spot!
Bomb shakes and healthy food, love coming here everytime I come to Vegas, bison burger and mass shake are on point

First and foremost.. If you think the food is "mediocre" you most likely live off of highly saturated fatty foods and empty carbs. 

Food is wonderful!

The atmosphere is welcoming, clean and visually appealing.

The only place I could eat out while prepping for my show. They are more than accommodating when it comes to subbing or creating a perfect meal to meet your needs.
First time here and I was not disappointed. I got the "sexy bitch" bowl. It's so great to have a healthy eating place close by. I can't wait to try something else. So yummy!

My girlfriend and I went to this place when we were doing the 30 day Paleo diet. Parking lot is packed so give yourself a couple minutes extra if your on a time constraint. Walking in feel pretty welcoming with lots of things to look at. We ordered the bison burger without bread and was pleased with how it tasted. This is not gonna be a gourmet burger but when trying to eat healthy it really did hit the spot.

The item on their menu we liked most was the real fruit smoothies. It didnt seem like it had any added sugars or even those fake sugars like turbinado or aspartame.

Really liked the fact that you cant even choose to drink a soda because they don't have any.

Pricing will seem a bit high but I think its mostly spot on with how expensive organics and grass fed beef stuff is.

Owner seems really nice.

I have one complaint and its really a small one. When we were there they were running one of those little vacuums that is only a little noisy. I don't know if the owner is OCD but a vacuum while eating is just an itty bitty complaint. The place is really spotless.

All in all I really like t his place for giving me a choice to go to for when I'm trying to eat clean. There really isn't a lot of places like that in Vegas. I am going to go back as I find that its worth it.

HATE  Nothing.

DISLIKE  Location is kind of far from home. Cashier was not very customer service oriented. Kind of pricey.

LIKE  The smoothies. The breakfast items. Availability of healthier condiments.

LOVE  The bowls. Plenty of protein!

Ok so if you are a genetically inclined skinny minny like myself  and can sit amongst all the beautifully chiseled health gym rats without feeling guilty this place is the SHIT! lol i love the expresso menu options! I ordered the PH Bison Wrap it was actually very flavorful considering there isnt any sauce on it (im a sauce addict). all in all i recommend this spot if your not in a hurry. Good food takes time
This place is great. Good food and usually good service. Gave 4 stars because sometimes the service is a little off. Go often so not so bad it scares you away.
Portobello mushrooms are the bomb .. All meals look amazing , recommend it for serious people that want to be healthy and a little cheeky at the same time .

WOW!

That was a lot of food in a bowl! I had some combo thing with couscous, it was very good.

Weightlifter/workout friends of mine swear by this place, but I thought it was very good for mere mortals like myself.

They need to reposition the beverage area, as it interferes with the line to order and pay for food.

Overall, pretty amazing and looks like a much needed food option for Henderson.
I wish the portions were bigger but that's not even fair to say because of the amount of food I normally eat. I've eaten here twice now and this place is so good, both times were in the same day.
The surroundings are a cut above the typical fast food restaurant and the staff is very friendly.  The PH Burger was delicious! It is a nice place to have a healthy meal.  Ill definitely be back!

Greens and Proteins on actual steroids. The walls are covered in bodybuilder photos, and the food is actually cooked rather than assembled down the way at Greens. 

It is pricey, though. The cheapest thing on the menu is a $4.99 post-workout shake that is frothy and fluffy and delicious and a good thing for my post-yoga muscles. The bowls will run you $10-14, but I definitely have had enough for two meals so it's not too terrible. 

Parking is kind of a drag since it is in a very cramped shopping center, especially during the lunch rush since there are so many places to eat in here. Recommended for healthy options in this area!
Delicious and truly a healthy clean meal.

Took a summer road trip with the family and this was our breakfast stop. Have had lunch here, which was delicious. Breakfast portions were generous. The whole family ranging in ages 3-40 years old loved it. Will be making the stop when in Vegas again.

Upon arrival into Vegas, I was in need of protein to fit my macros. Great selection of foods.. While my visit was more than weeks ago and I cannot recall what I ordered, I remember the meats were GOOD, the protein pancakes were of good flair.. I will be certain to visit again in my future affairs to Vegas

I gave this place two tries......I thought the first time was just a hiccup because they were newly opened and they needed to get their groove together. 
BUT I WAS WRONG!

When I pickup a takeout order I always look in each box to make sure everything is right, I failed to do so this time!  I took a quick peek at a few boxes, seemed to be right but I was wrong!!!
When I got back to the office we opened our boxes and two out of four were wrong.  The two that were wrong were mixed up.  I drove back, they remade it but did not seem concerned about the quality of their services. 
One staff member tried to bring me a left over smoothie to help out, cool dude..left over?  Uggh no thanks. 

About a week later the office wanted to try it again, so this time I made sure to look in the boxes....well 3 out of 4 were right!  Of course, mine was the one they messed up on AGAIN!  I even looked in the box and it seemed to look good. 

I did the "make your own bowl"  but I guess what I had asked for was too complicated for them because they ended up making a signature bowl they already offer.  

ON THE TICKET/RECEIPT it is listed correctly so I do not know who is being lazy in the kitchen!  

I did not go back to fix it, it just wasnt worth my time. 

I probably will not try this place again unless I am forced to.

Very disappointed. I ordered a ROOTS juice specifically because I love the combination of ingredients and hope the lemon & ginger offset the earthy dirt like taste of beets. I couldn't taste ANY lemon or ginger, and based on the fact I went home squeezed one entire lemon & grated some ginger into my juice...And THEN it tasted like the first ROOTS juice I had at PH... I'm guessing the juice want made correctly.

The food is really amazing here! The bison burger is a great post workout meal! The a√ßai bowl is good for breakfast too! Overall this place has really good food especially if you're a fitness freak and love to stay healthy

I usually come here for my acai smoothie or bowl without coconut flakes and extra bananas (plus granola-what it usually comes with). 

Today I go in and ordered a smoothie, changed my mind and ordered a bowl instead and got a smoothie in a bowl. Not only did they add coco flakes but they also forgot the granola. The first time I got the bowl, the coco was sprinkled on. The second time, it was blended in. Coco makes my mouth itch so it was a little irritating that either the barista was too lazy to make a new bowl or that the counter girl didn't remember the 5 times I told her no coco extra bananas. It would be helpful if the cashier listened to their customers. Really unsatisfied with my visit this morning.
Ok place, food is kind of tasteless and service leaves a lot to be desired, but overall it's okay

I have tried many bowls here... And I want to try everything everything on their menu.  I love everything I had so far.  I love the hulk smoothie too must try...... This place caters to your dietary restriction too.  They make vegan protein smoothie.  They open at 9am every day.  How convenient!

OMG, Passed this place a ton of times, family, workout buddies and friends go there and many people from LVAC and Lifetime As I have Discussed with them!

I was a personal trainer for 10 years, over 30,000 sessions under my belt!

So I finally gave in and drug my butt in there after my morning workout for some breakfast!  YUM! YUM! YUM!

I was very impressed with the interior, great setting and ambiance to sit down and eat, the staff was very professional and I had a chance to speak to the owner/manager!  Awesome Team and the drinks and food was prepared great and food came out quickly!

I had a awesome veggie drink "so good for me" and I had a egg white omelet with some fruit!  It was so good, good for me and gave my body the replenishment of protein and carbs needed after a strong intense workout!

I definitely recommend this place to all who have fitness as a lifestyle or just want to eat healthier!

Great place to stop and get a protein shake After that intense workout!
Yum - So Good For You!

A MUST GO FOR ALL!

Was excited to go, as it was recommended to us by friends. Unfortunately, it was not all we had expected. 

Service was OK, as the person who took our order didn't know the nutritional value of the menu items, which you would expect in a "body builders" paradise. The menu had a lot of choices, with some specific GF options, however, anyone who is Gluten Free knows that any meal can be combined to make it GF. What about wheat and soy free?  What about other allergies?  They are not addressed at all.  Also, if you're seated, they call your number or name from behind the counter, rather than bringing you your order.  I don't need to workout and get my meal, if I'm sitting sipping tea with friends/colleagues and picking up our meals in plastic bowls with plastic utensils just added to our disappointment, and without trays, took a few trips to the counter, which took time away from a nice lunch. Add a tacky "tip cup" at the register, made the obligation uncomfortable as there was no "service", as after the meal, we had to return our bowls to the counter. 

The restaurant was clean, with a nice vibe, contemporary, but a little over the top with the owner overly self promoting with her photos everywhere and we  were tired of looking up at the walls.  Then it continued all the way into the bathroom. Exhausting and overdone. 

Focus should be in the food, service and ambiance. Like any good food establishment, especially one that is supposed to pride itself on nutrition, there is no nutritional values attached to any item on the menu. 

It's a place to visit ONCE to try the assorted menu items, as I always give the opportunity for improvement, which is why I gave it 3 stars, rather than my first choice of 2 stars. 

For the price and service, there are too many other great options in the area to eat in or take out a great, nutritional meal. I feel that this is a promotional platform for the owner, not a nutritional, "stay fit" establishment.

Love everything about this place! If you're a health person and like to have healthy options this is the place for you! The coffee is a plus too...always good coffee! It's a regular stop for me when going to Vegas
Great options for healthy high protein meal options. Wish we had this in Tucson I would be there all the time.

Very overpriced for what you get. The owners always take over a large table in the back dining area and rather than greeting customers, they seem bothered that people are around them.  It feels like you are coming into someone's office to eat.  

Go down the street to Greens & Proteins. It's a much friendlier environment. In fact one of the Protein House employees was eating there in his uniform. That should say everything.

This place is over hyped. It's like every other place except made with "clean" ingredients which really makes only the slightest of difference. It has decent food but I don't know if I could see myself going back again.

The name of this restaurant says and all and it cries out in goodness which is what I was looking for. I did not have time this morning for coffee or any fruits and veggies so I thought I would try there take in them. I ended up ordering my favorite coffee beverage Carmel macchiato with soy milk so that I have my caffeine intake. I ordered the monster greens to replace the produce I normally eat in the morning.

I love their saying all over the posters , "eat with purpose." That could not be truer and our bodies respond to what we put in them, so I keeping with the new healthy me this establishment has my vote. Wow the coffee is so smooth and has no after taste like some lattes leave. The monster greens is great too. It tasted so good and to know that it is good for me is even better.

I popped my Proteinhouse cherry the other day and I'm not going to lie I wasn't very impressed.

They have a very extensive menu which was a bonus and I might try them out for lunch (I had breakfast this visit). I got a Berry Blast Acai Bowl and while the portion was gigantic (For $11.00 Im glad it was) I only had a few bites because it honestly wasn't that good.

Maybe its me coming from San Diego, home of the perfected Acai Bowl, but this place was lacking. I've tasted crushed ice with more flavor.

On top of the lack luster food the people who work there are like really intimidating. Would it kill any of you to smile? They were seriously unfriendly, but after eating my Acai Bowl I understand why.

I'm a bit disappointed. ***NOT Paleo Diet Friendly*** 

My girlfriend suggested Protein House because they are marketed as a healthy food option. 

After looked at the menu, I decided that I wanted to try the South Beach Pancakes because they are gluten free. I noticed the large black jugs of Muscle Infusion protein stacked on shelves above the food preparation area....and they did not appear to be an all natural whey protein brand. 

I asked to review the ingredients of whey protein that they used in the pancakes (Muscle Infusion brand). This protein is LOADED with CORN SYRUP, SUCRALOSE, PARTIALLY HYDROGENATED COCONUT OIL, and other unhealthy crap. 

Being a healthy restaurant must extend beyond the marketing of a business; the ingredients used in your dishes must also be healthy. 

God idea...bad execution. 

My suggestion: Use an all natural brand of whey protein (whey is used as their protein ingredient in dishes) and stop putting artificial sweeteners, corn syrup, and other unhealthy stuff in your food.

A new restaurant in the valley named Protein House.  With a name like that, of course I need to see what's really going on.  Located off Eastern Avenue near LVAC and Gold's Gym, Protein House is another restaurant that offers healthy eats with a ton of protein. But to me, PH is not just another healthy meal stop. PH offers smoothies, breakfast, burgers, bowls, and salads. To order, you can either go straight to the counter and place your order off their menu. Or, you can take their order checklist, select your meal, and then hand it to the counter.  You also have the option to build your own burger, salad, and bowl.  Because this was my first visit, I decided on their biggest and baddest burger, their Muscle Builder Burger. This burger is 12 oz of ground Bison, onions, cheese, and Canadian bacon all served in a whole wheat bun. I had this medium well and swear that this is one of the best bison burgers I have ever had.  Most exotic meats like bison come gamey and with no taste. Here at PH, they found a way to create this burger with flavor.  By the way, trying to up your protein for the day? This burger has to be close to 70 grams of protein.  Yeah buddy!

As for the restaurant itself, I felt that it is a little small. But I love the ambiance, decor, and service. One things for sure, there's a ton of fit peeps eating here. I also got the opportunity to meet one of the owners, Andrew Bic. To be successful in any venture, it comes down to how you treat people. Andrew got this right. He took the time to chat it up, ask for suggestions, and gave a little insight of what PH is all about.  I didn't get the chance to meet the other owner, Larissa  Reis, but look forward to it on future visits.  If you're use to the taste that a 1000 calorie burger joint has to offer, then maybe Protein House is not for you.  If you're looking for some quality macros with high amounts of protein in a burger, then give Protein House a shot.  

Wish List:
-Ostrich:  With about the same amount of protein as steak and with calories/fat that rival chicken, I think ostrich should be on their menu.
-Nutritional Information:  For a place that specializes in selling healthy meals, I think this information is necessary.  Per the owner, this is in the works with a dietitian.

PS: Like all other healthy eating locations (i.e Whole Foods, Greens & Protein, etc), expect a higher price tag here.  But through their build-your-own, you can actually get a meal fairly cheap.
Meh! A bit overpriced the help is kind of snooty. The food is only ok I probably won't go back
Delicious... nutritious... Great atmosphere, friendly staff. This just became my new favorite place.

A couple of co-workers wanted to stop in for lunch yesterday and I was pleasantly surprised. There are not a lot of fast healthy options out there, but PH hits the mark with their high protien meal items, and menu design to easily control calories and macros. The food is GOOD too. I had the bison cheese steak wrap, and it was filling, tasted good, and came with a side of fresh fruit instead of greasy fries/chips. 

They also have a cooler full of energy drinks (including my current favorite - Bang) in addition to a protien shake bar and normal soft drinks.

Food comes in the form of bowls, wraps, or sandwiches, all of which have a wide variety of protiens and sizes, so there is something for everyone.

Awesome stuff overall. I will return.

Never been to a protein house location before, I walked in was greeted, I even told the guy I was a first timer. Only thing that irked me was, he didn't offer to help with suggestions or anything. He was just told me to let him know I was ready and walked away. Why the four stars...
But apparently I ordered a bowl, not a burger. Like I thought I was with the build your own. But, it was actually pretty good. I made it with the bison meat, sweet potatoes, onions and cheese w/side of BBQ.  Prices are decent, $13 for all that, not too bad. I also ordered the Chocolate PB crush protein shake was delicious.
Foods good but the cashier Ana seemed like she hated her job and made it very uncomfortable to order. Bad customer service at this location.

The Protein House on Eastern in Las Vegas Left Me Disappointed

My hubby and I are kind of health nuts, by that I mean we work out 5-6 days per week and eat a 98% non processed vegan diet.

I was with my son at Sams Club right nearby and was starving, so I thought that I would go out and check out the Protein House. I thought for sure it would be a healthy menu that I could get something I would not regret eating.

Walking in the Protein House, I felt a little uncomfortable, there was a huge guy, likely a body builder or fighter hovering over the cashier, and he didn't seem extremely friendly. But, I did take this as a good sign that bodies were the focus in this place and I liked that. 

I was right, it is a healthy menu, however I do have a problem with a place that calls itself the "Protein House" or "Greens and Proteins" for that matter and they have not gotten with the times, that a lot of people do not eat meat anymore. This place does get "kudos" for having a vegan protein on the menu, which Greens and Proteins does not, but its vegetarian and vegan options for food are a little on the "down low."

Why don't you have tofu options for your salads, bowls, etc? or Gardein? Heck the Yardhouse has an entire Gardein menu, get a clue!

They have a black bean and quinoa veggie burger and a veggie bowl. The veggie bowl can be quinoa or brown rice and I love both, but they don't come with a sauce. So, I asked what the sauce was and they looked at me like I was crazy. It doesn't come with a sauce they said, do you want a sauce on the side, and I said yes. What do you have? 

The girl was very nice and said we have bbq, teriyaki, balsalmic, blah blah many others. Ok, so I went with teriyaki as I am vegan and I figured this would be the least likely to get messed up with some cheese or cream or something so I chose that one. I specifically asked for NO mushrooms, its the one veggie that I hate.

I had to ask how to get my bottle of water and it was uncomfortably quiet in there while I waited for my food, except for the massive TV with the SF 49r's game on and my six year old which were great contributions to the action. They have a table set up in the back that appears to be their office, I found that tacky... now I have some ideas if they want them to make that table cool and fit the theme, like make it a judges table, autograph table or nutrition booth or something, but to sit out there in the public like that is just unprofessional. 

When I did receive my food, it was FULL of mushrooms, but I was starving and it wasn't meat or cheese so I attempted to pick them out as I went along. The veggies were gorgeous, asparagus, peppers, cauliflower, zucchini and the quinoa was cooked perfectly. My only suggestion is for them not to cut the veggies up so small, this is the main part of the veggie dish and they were diced teeny tiny seeming like I was still missing the main dish.

Oh, the sauce... well the first sauce was my teriyaki and it looked creamy! How does teriyaki get creamy? I don't know, but I'm not eating it. I asked for something else, I got the balsamic. It looked chunky and not like any balsamic I have ever seen. So, unfortunately my opinion on the sauces is very poor. If you serve a bowl of any kind, don't you need a sauce?

I guess I'm the only one who ever asked for a sauce as they looked at me like an alien when I asked for one. Last but not least. SALT. I know, its not the best for you, but I need flavor on my food.

At the Protein House, I walked around and found pepper but no salt. And, they couldn't find salt. I mean I know you are a bunch of manly and womanly body builder types, but 99% of the population wants some salt on their food.

They finally found me some in the kitchen in a cabinet and had to put it in a little dish for me. Wow, Gordon Ramsay would have had a hay day with that episode.

All in all, I appreciate the whole idea of the place, its supposed to be trendy and focused on body building, but they have to be realistic that the bodybuilding population is such a small percentage of their potential revenue, that they have to open their minds to all the other healthy people out there that might want to eat there.

After today, I will not go back, unless of course I see a change of the way I was treated or (sized up), the menu and the atmosphere. Otherwise if they were going on food only, minus the mushroom mistake, the food concept is one that I would love!

Quite good if you're into a healthy meal. Located in Eastern by Cafe Rio and Grimaldi's Pizza, Protein House is known for their high protein, nutrient packed meals. 
Items ordered today; BBQ grilled chicken bowl with half quinoa/half brown rice. Loads of broccoli, bell peppers, onions in a fluffy bed of quinoa and brown rice, chunks of grilled chicken with Paleo BBQ sauce, slices of avocado, it was filling and tasty. I also ordered the Sweet Greens juice, full of spinach, lime, cucumber, pear, Apple and agave, I asked for loads of extra ginger- zing pow! Hubby got the Peanut Butter Dream smoothie with almond milk and no yogurt, it was like a dessert. He also got the Muscle Builder burger (sin cheese) with a side of sweet potato mash. He said it was excellent. 
Interior is clean and modern. Service was friendly.  Portions are big, but no organic options which is a bummer, but everything was still quite nutrient dense, good food combos. 
Will return again.

I like this place,  good variety of dishes,  sandwiches and drinks.  Who would ever think of healthy food on Vegas.  The city of decadence  overload, but this place hits the spot for nearly all healthy tasty treats.  Go once,  go again.

Delicious and healthy! I always consider it a perfect success when we find a place that my husband and I can both enjoy. From burgers to salads, bowls and smoothies, this place has something clean and whole for everyone. 

Also, I can't have gluten or dairy and there were several great options that I could have! It's rare to find a place with so many options for me...and that actually taste good.
OMG where to begin? Tiny portions, clueless staff, horrible music and overall just a weird vibe. If you want protein just grab a shake from the gym and skip this place.

Came here on a rainy day with friends and wanted a post-workout meal from an intense hot pilates workout. You can never go wrong with the Sexy Bitch Bowl (snark snark), sans the red onions (because I dislike everything onion except for green) and 'shrooms (just because). It had the perfect blend of quinoa (noms), broccoli (yum), avocado (AVOOOO!!!), asparagus (bye bye water weight) and squash (I barely ever eat this stuff) - my only wish is that they have tomatoes or lime for me to squeeze onto. The salmon was soft in texture but not so buttery as I would like it to be. Needless to say I was filled and my burning insides were heartily satisfied. This would be my go-to, that's to say if I come here often after working out. 

I asked for a citrusy juice and they recommended the Summer - it was indeed citrusy however nothing extraordinary as any other blended healthy drink. 

Take note that they only offer the 10% off Yelp Check-In deal if you plan to write a review.
Best place to eat clean , to buy all my meal prep for the week . Everything taste delicious because you can see it's fresh made in front of you .
I get the southwest bowl on occasion and everytime i get it its ALWAYS different!! One day itll have red peppers in it, one day with corn, one day something missing like avocado. Its very annoying.

This place was not as all what I expected, but I throughly enjoyed it! There were so many different menu items that sounded not only healthy, but completely appetizing. I went the Sexy Bitch Bowl and let me tell you, it certainly tasted sexy. The veggies were perfectly steamed, the salmon beautifully cooked and tender. I ate every last morsel and didn't feel one once of guilt! 

If you're looking for a place to make you feel like you're making healthy choices you've got to check it out! The one "heads up" I will share is that it can be a bit intimidating. Between the dozens of photos adorning the walls and the endless gym buffs dining along side you, it really makes you feel like you need to get your rear in gear!

The acai bowls and smoothies are great.  However I no longer prefer eating whey foods.  I had the chocolate monster pancakes and they were very bland.  Along with the steam veggies, being very mediocre .  Overall if you're a fitness head,  this place rocks!

The dishes are a bit overpriced, but the establishment is spacious and clean.  I give this place a 3 star rating because it has some good, and lackluster dishes.  It's what a business should be, however it's not amazing nor my favorite place.
Favorite healthy spot in Vegas. Right next to Golds so I go right after training. Clean food and tastes amazing.

I work up the street from this place and its a great lunch spot to resort to when there's so many fast food places around to tempt you! I'm attempting to try all of the signature bowls that they have.. So far I have not been disappointed! Full of flavor and just the right portion.

I had Green Monster: Spanish,  pineapple,  honeydew,  lime, ginger, kale and coconut water. The ginger is strong and the lime zest is different. But I think I like it  but I'm having texture problems. 
Berry Lovers Signature Salad: spring mix, cucumbers,  green onions,  strawberries,  blueberries, Raspberries, grilled chicken with balsamic vinaigrette. The salad was really good

Beyond Humbled & Exited to work right next to one of the best Restaurants in the Las Vegas region. If you want to keep your Results & Goals in mind while at the same time as having a great delicious meal catered to you without being bland or boring like your typical prep foods, this is the place to be! You know what you should and shouldn't put into your body, Protein House allows that to be possible with their many various items on the menu to choose from, including the many "Build Your Own" options, and even in-house prepped sweet treats to crave that sweet tooth without the guilt! From the food to the employees, it's nothing but a great time thru the whole process!

I love protein house!! So happy they're close to home. We need more restaurants like this. So healthy! I usually get the sexy bitch bowl. It's amazing! The salmon is always so fresh! They're great if you want substitutions or have food allergies/sensitivities. The protein ice creams good too!

Great concept.  Nice menu.  I want to like the place.  Service is subpar.  Messed up order.  Last two trips I felt I was a bother.  The employees were busy chatting and seemed disengaged.  Place could be a home run with better service.

Also, foul language on menu, not cool.  Missing out on a lot of family business.  Place has tasty food, but service is a disgrace.

Went back and service is much better.  Great menu.

The quality of the food was good. One of the only places in the area I can add bison into my meal. For the amount of food and taste, I was impressed. But I ordered just one bowl to-go and it was $19 and quite cold. The place felt clean, but the girl at the front counter did not seem like a good fit for the business and was unprofessional. Another male employee was unprofessional as well and was cursing a lot in front of myself and other customers. Not sure I will go back to this location anytime soon due to the overpriced options and meh service.

Every thing on the menu is great. My favorites are the Thai bowl and chocolate protein pancakes. Their apple pie protein shake really makes me want to cry less about dieting along with their fresh baked cookies they sell in store. I love that they have a lot of options for their proteins including my favorite, bison.
