It's nice to see a place cater to the fitness industry. They serve generous portions and the staff is friendly. Great menu

Southwest bowl w brown rice. Was delcious! I have no complaints about the food and speed of service. I was not greeted upon entering or even acknowledged. So that needs some customer service work but the food was made promptly and accurately and tasted great.

I love everything about this place. The food it's absolutely amazing. It's the most delicious healthy food I ever tried 
Sooooo tasty

The owner, Andrew, contacted me to explain that they have a new POS system. That's fine, my issue was with the way we were treated like a inconvenience for making a standard request :( Also I ordered a latte that never came out and when I asked about it for second time on way out the new girl questioned if I ordered it / paid for it and made me show receipt!

Not my kinda place. It's like walking into a Gold's Gym, may they Rest In Peace. Staff is off-putting in the same way one might feel at an anti-social muscle gym. I feel bad for people who are out of shape that have to be surrounded by posters of fitness models.

CONs:
First, the Feng Shui is off. If you are facing the bar, you would expect to order on the right and pick up on the left. It's the opposite here. Awkward place to stand while you order, claustrophobic space. During lunch I watched every single person who ordered get confused by this.

Customer service was terrible and I did not tip. The female cashier was very meek, lacked desire for life and had zero enthusiasm. 

Men's restroom is full of cleaning/maintenance equipment(ladder) that overflows into the restroom stall.
Lastly, I was given a number to place on my table as if a waiter would be bringing me my order. Instead, I was beckoned by a chef to pick up my order at the counter. If I am dinning in and you give me a number to place on my table, you should put those double doors to good use and bring out the $12 salad to my table.

PROs: Himalayan Salt and  cracked pepper at table. Berry Salad was a 4 out of 5. Lettuce tasted a little dirty.

Great place if your looking for a healthy alternative to food. They have amazing food that tastes so good you will question weather or not you are actually eating healthy food. The major problem with this place however is twofold. First, their customer service sucks, point blank period, nothing else needs to be said about that. Second, their prices are outrageous!! I know that it costs more money to eat healthy but what they are charging is freaking robbery!! They are literally charging $14.00 for a burger at a fast food place? Thats just unheard of and the average person is not going to be able to afford eating food that is priced that expensively. I like the place, because i truly enjoy living a healthy life, but i mean, come on. $14 bucks for a burger is just ridiculous.

Service was outstanding! Food prepared quick with LARGE PORTIONS for a very low price. I am amazed by the low prices that the Protein House has. I loved the chocolate dessert muffin. Mmmmm! Larissa Reiss has a goldmine here! Go check it out!

So grateful to find a healthy option !!! In town for family holiday, and all the bad food that comes with that, so this was a very welcome reprieve! I got the "general bowl" and a green tea latte. Both were delicious! Thankful for the free wifi, nice decor... could do without the dance music blaring, but otherwise happy.

Ok, back a second time, I'm still doing whole30. This time I got the PH hash (egg whites, bison, veggies). This was waaay better than the burger. Everything else still applies (if you aren't eating clean, you'll be disappointed), but this meal was much better. It's nice to have a restaurant that caters to this lifestyle.

We ordered 3 PH Chopped salads.  We did not phone in the order, we had someone go order them and bring them back.  When we got home we noticed there was not any avocado on any of the salads???  Really???  3 Salads and all 3 were. It made with all the ingredients as stated on the menu?

Why is it so hard to pay attention to detail and prepare foods the way it's stated on the menu?  

I don't come here often, my daughter and son in law do and when you pay $14 for a salad, you should be given everything the menu says and what you are expecting.

The salad was good but it was very disappointing there was no avocado on the salad.  I guess now we can't trust that we are getting what we ordered and we need to inspect our food before we leave the place.  We should not have to, management should be making sure all food coming out is prepared properly.  I may give them another shot but it's iffy as this was a huge let down.
Cool new spot.  Veggie burger was good.

LOL, Jesse N. mentioned how this show was on Mystery Diners.  aaahhheeemm, I pointed that out.  Hahaha.

Cute little spot neatly designed with IKEA fixtures.  

Anyhow, this place is definitely for your protein fix.  You can even find some drink specials on Groupon.  We didn't come for the drinks, we wanted to try the food that was available.  I had the Sexy Bitch which was Salmon sitting on top of quinoa and veggies.  I thought it was rather delicious and portioned to my liking.  I wouldn't say it wowed me, but it was healthy protein eats.  We weren't sure to leave our dishes on the table, but we did bring it up towards the counter.  So that was a bit confusing.  

I like that the menu is detailed and lets you know what ingredients are in it, consumers should feel happy about that!  This is def a place for my hubs now that he trying to bring sexy back (after putting on some sympathy pregnancy weight) and I wouldn't mind tagging along with him.

I've been here a few times and I must say that I'm enjoying it more more after I go there each time. The prices are little high, but I do understand, because it's all made fresh and healthy and that's the best part!
If it wasn't so far from me I'd be eating here all the time! Anything bison, I'm sold! Love the food quality and staff is friendly and helpful!

Woooooooow  **jaw dropped** the food is amazing! Plus the owner is absolutely gorgeous!! Plus!!! The cashier was amazing :)) she is so sweet and pretty!! Keep up the great work!! 
But ... 
I gave this 4 stars because the price was a little high for me. But overall the food is great and the employees are so nice. :)

Finally get to try this place! This was definitely on the top of my list to do while here in Vegas, hit up Gold's gym and post workout grub here at protein house. Food are amazing! Bison burger tastes like its made from heaven, friendly staff, from owners to their kitchen guys everyone are so nice! Sucks that we don't have protein house in San Diego :/

...dont care to much for the shake.. only had 1 so far... and a honey dew water with coconut  water and some other shit in it lol ...witch was good ... but that blond hair chick that works there ...oh God, shes like a  Goddess/lioness... lets just say id bite that lofl

Didn't know this place was for muscle heads :) hence the name should've told me.  Anyway, we tried it out and it was ok. Not our cup of tea but I wouldn't mind trying some other items on the menu.  My salmon was over cooked though.  They give generous portions and the decor was nice.  No high chairs though so it seems not a kid friendly place.  I guess people that work out done eat out with their kids?? I was bugged by that.

I love this place! It's my go-to lunch spot when I'm on break at class! The menu is so diverse and delicious while keeping with trend of being high in protein and relatively healthy! I never feel like it's a cheat meal eating out here.

So we came here cause epoxy gave us a gift card to redeem to check out new places.. 
Coming inside open minded, we stopped by the menu on the right to let the other people get in front of the line.  Out of the whole time, us looking confused (cause we've never been there before), no one offered to help with the menu.  We had to stop someone.

Food was mediocre.  Not a big fan. Seemed like the owners didn't appreciate our business.  Didn't feel welcomed at all & the food was too much for such mediocre taste

Food is delicious! 

PH has a number of options and the food is great. The pancakes were awesome as were the bowls and burgers. A little on the pricey side but I would definitely go back! My kids loved it too.

So I ate here tonight and ordered a Bison burger and I have to say that it was the driest piece of meat that I've ever had the displeasure of eating. This is not my first Bison burger and I understand that it is a lean meat but a competitor down the street makes a VERY juicy top notch Bison burger so this place has no excuse.

Will definitely not be back.

Interesting place. Basically if you aren't healthy oriented, this is not the place for you. Their menu features items like
Bison on quinoa or broccoli. They have smoothies. Perfect place for post workout! The eating area is clean and hip. Recommend after workout!

We order two bison burger meals and it clearly states on the menu different bread options so we chose Ezekiel bread. The cashier then told us our total and immediately sounded wrong but I didn't say anything initially, I paid her and she said our meal would be called by number when ready and was ready to ring up the next customer. I had to ask for my receipt and she seemed irritated. We got the receipt and and noticed a $4 charge. We were charged $2 extra per burger for the choice of Ezekiel bread. It's only $4 and we would have no problem paying BUT it does NOT state that there is an extra charge for different bread on the menu. It actually says "with your choice of..." Or something along those lines. AND the cashier did NOT mention that the bread is an additional cost. Again, the money part doesn't bother us but the lack of communication from the cashier AND that the menu is MISLEADING. This is just straight bad customer service and SHADY. We brought it to her attention and she acknowledged that it does not state the extra charge on the menu but it's on her computer so she had to charge us. Hopefully these cashiers will at least be courteous from not on and let paying customers know. She did offer our money back but we declined because that wasn't the point. Also, I ordered sweet potato "sticks" and they are NOT sticks. They're cubed sweet potatoes. Annoying. Not worth the $34! I'm all about paying extra for healthy food but when places are shady with pricing and customer service is crap that's where I draw the line. I think Daily Kitchen is WAY better and Greens n Proteins as well.  The burger was good but not good enough for me to ever come back. I hope the owner reads this and takes this into consideration. Ps, they also don't have free wifi which the other places do. That's an important factor to me as when I visit these places I tend to do some work which free wifi is a nice complimentary gift in my opinion.
Great place to go to when you want to eat healthy. The food is great and everyone seems nice. Alittle pricy, but worth it if you just don't have the time to make healthy meals at home.

Unfortunately this place isn't what I was hoping for. The food is good and the cooks are great but front of house is really not knowledgable on their food. This is suppose to be a health kitchen so they should be able to modify my meals to what I need but simply don't know how. When asked what kind of squash is in one of ther signature dishes their response is idk. How do you not know? And if you don't why can't you find out? Same thing when asked what white dishes do you guys have? Is there oil in that sauce? What about sugar? These things are important for people on specific meal plans. It's frustrating when you do not know anything and seem too annoyed to find out. Though the food is good I'm afraid to eat it in fear that it will have something I specified I can't have. Both times I've been here had the same issue with the same girl. They need to be more knowledgable.

This place is amazing! It's a very cool concept pulled of flawlessly.  I got the pH burger (Bison burger) and it was very good! It's a little expensive, but it's a place filled with amazing tasting protein food so it's expected. I also got the Peanut Butter Dream protein shake, 10/10 amazing, would have again. I'll definitely be back for sure.

Had really looked forward to going to this place but they got both mine and my mother's order completely wrong and screwed it up. The employees were all too busy staring at their phones to notice what they were doing. Paid too much to have my food messed up.

This is an interesting place and has some potential. This was my first time here, however, I do like to cook and eat healthy meals myself.

The food was OK, the meat was a bit bland and seemed to lack even the basic flavor. I think with some work this place can turn around and tailor to everyone who enters the door. Not yet though.

I just tried protein house for the 1st time,And I was throughly impressed. The ambience was amazing! And the menu was very diverse. I went with the sexy bitch bowl. Perfectly cooked salmon over a bed of quinoa! With some veggies. It was Phenomenal! You can taste the fresh ingredients!! Also an honorable mention would be the fact that they have no soda machine! I love that! I hate seeing a health based restaurant serving soda! If you're like me it's hard enough to be watching your weight. With that said will power is damn near non existent! So it's nice to not have any temptations! The only thing negative I would say is the prices are somewhat high! I would definitely suggest this place to anyone!!!

Been here plenty of times when I lived here. When visiting this weekend I decided to drop by and was very disappointed. 

I ordered the Aloha Signature burger which comes with grilled chicken, pineapple, red onion and teriyaki sauce. When I received the burger I thought it looked a little... Plain. I noticed they had forgotten the pineapple. So I took the burger back to the counter and asked for pineapple. The cook didn't seem to speak English and did not understand me so the cashier was explaining they didn't have the regular pineapple slice.???? But they could cut some up and put it on in chunks. They seemed almost put out by my request. They put the pineapple on in chunks with a really shitty presentation so as soon as I tried to pick it up the burger contents fell all over wooden plank plate. 

The fact that they tried to short me the main ingredient on my burger then implied to me that they were put out by adding it and then was a terrible presentation makes me not want to return again. 

Very poor customer service and rapport with a local who knows a lot of locals.

This place is really great.  Lots of healthy options and the staff is always really nice.  Pretty quick to get in and out but I like to call ahead and grab food to go.  My favorites are the protein pancakes and I love their Portabello chicken sandwich!  So good.

I really enjoy this place a lot!  I am in search of some down home simple food that is healthy, high in protein, low in sugar and great in taste.  This is the place to go!

Compared to something popular like SkinnyFats where they won't advertise their nutritional information, Protein House is all about giving you the information.

The food:

Signature Bowls - They have many types of bowls that are good sources of protein served over quinoa, brown rice or 50/50 both.  Each has a bit of veggies on it.  The El Jefe is a bit more expensive due to the amount of mean, since you are getting about 12 ounces of lean protein!

Southwest Bowl - Top Sirloin.
Greek Bowl - Ground Turkey
BBQ Bowl - Chicken
Vegetarian Bowl - Bunch of good Veggies
Teriyaki Bowl - Salmon
El Jefe - Turkey and Bison

Signature Burgers - I haven't tried these yet, but we are talking Bison Meat, egg whites, chicken, turkey in their variety of different choices on the menu.  

Smoothies - I also haven't tried these yet, but we are talking some serious healthy ingredients! 240 to over 600 calories depending on what you want.  Protein amounts will vary.

Breakfast - Love pancakes and I often don't eat them due to the carbs.  Here, they have multigrain Whey Pancakes with egg whites.  Whoo Hoo!  They also have plenty of other items like Hash, Quesadilla, and even loaded oatmeal that you can add protein to!

The place:

Great music, TV, and either tall boy tables, couch seating or regular tables. Clean, friendly, helpful.  This is generally a order, pay and pick up your food type of place.

The Extras:

If you like low sugar Quest Bars, they sell them here!.  They have coffees and Frappuccinos as well as some specials and juices!

I like this place, be sure to check it out!

Adore this place and go EVERY time I'm in Vegas. Amazing variety on the menu and always keeps me on point with my macros.

Plus, guaranteed fitness star sightings with every visit.
Good food! We went for a post workout meal and I really like the greek bowl with half brown rice, half quinoa. Only reason I can't give 5 stars is because it is a little pricey.

Great spot to keep you motivated for the New Year!! I don't think you can order something unhealthy here. Plus when you look around inside you want to immediately go to the gym after placing your order.

I ordered a BBQ Turkey burger with side of sweet potato sticks.  Burger was pretty good but I didn't like the sweet potato sticks. Maybe they would taste better if they were cut like fries. I didn't like that the food was served on a wood cutting board which was cracked and looked old.
My favorite place to eat in Vegas! I love the healthy choices! You have to try the sexy bitch bowl with quinoa and the southwest bowl with rice !

First time here. The menu is fantastic, and I had a very hard time choosing. I settled on the bison burger, and it was excellent. The burger and sweet potatoes were both perfectly cooked, hot and fresh. I don't come to the east side of town often, but will definitely make the effort to come back!
Both times here, food was bland and tasteless.   I guess it's healthy though, but if you actually enjoy eating, go elsewhere.

I went here a couple of weeks ago for lunch with a co-worker.. I had the berry lovers salad which was decent.. however the customer service I received was not the best. I am a larger person..not a body builder or slim by any means.. when someone is there spending their money on a service you provide.. it might be best not to make a comment to a co-worker to "check out this chick" and then have that co-worker look at me and laugh. Keep in mind .. customers are what keep you in business and employed.. if you need to make a comment or laugh.. best not to do it when the customer can see and hear you..

I don't know how long this place has been here, but in 4 years in the neighborhood, I just noticed the sign tonight.

I ordered the sexy bitch bowl (not sure I like that name) and it was very good. I'm sure to return when I want it again.  I see the pancakes are popular but I am GF and I don't know if there is an option for me.  I didn't ask if the burgers can also be offered GF.  But maybe I can just get it wrapped in lettuce?  Anyway, there are a couple of other things I want to check out here. But tonight was a good healthy start.

Awesome Salmon salad!   Hugh piece of salmon on a fluffy bed of super
fresh field greens!  Seasoned perfectly not drenched with dressing!  
The BEST espresso!    Thick gigantic smoothies!   Healthy, diverse menu! 
COOL URBAN decor filled with  "beautiful"  people dining inside, 
on the patio and working behind the counter!...
Clean, contemporary, healthy...have to go back!

Service was good and their pancakes were even better! We went for breakfast on a Sunday morning and it wasn't busy at all so we got speedy service. The waitress was super sweet, even brought out water for our dog to sip on while we ate!

Clean & Healthy Eating! It is not always easy to find a healthy food place with variety. The food here is made fresh to order and the place lives up to its name.  It was nice of them to offer 10% discount on Yelp.  I will be returning in the near future. I really liked this place and I didn't experience the negative reviews.

I'm pretty pissed off. I woke up expecting I would get an acai bowl since I heard great reviews about it and guess what! They don't have any at 915am on a Wednesday! Even better I pay for it and sit down and the owner tells the cashier to come up to me and say we're out. Really?? You can't even come up to me and say it yourself. Oh it even gets better they offer to make me a bowl for $8 without acai... CRAZY! I asked when they would receive acai they said they didn't know. So instead of eating healthy I went to bread and butter so i wouldn't be so pissed after having a sugar high. Never ever coming here again.

Went for lunch at a Friend's suggestion and I'm thrilled!  Unfortunately, it's not an easily accessible location for me- but it's not always about oneself;)  I don't live in Henderson, so why is there not one on the other side of town?! 
Customized by juice and wrap- now that's about me. Ha.
Fresh and good quality food!

So delicious! Love the revamped menu and Vegan options. We ordered the southwest veggie wrap and southwest veggie burger, both were filling and full of flavor! Yum! Places like Protein House make it so easy to go out to eat with non-vegans. We will definitely be back soon!

Totally bumbed out. We were looking forward to trying this place and was disappointed with the service and lack of attention to details. My daughter order the bison burger wrapped in lettuce with avacado and I ordered the thai wrap. They didn't give her what she asked for and I had no Thai sauce. I paid for the extra. I guess getting something to go and the employees more on the phone or worried about changing into skimpy outfits means I get what I paid for. Too bad other similar places just as close. Bummer.
Had the Muscle Freak smoothie today! Truly amazing and their menu looks intense - Really close to work and I will definitely be coming back often!!

When you walk into this place it looks great and you expect the food to be really good. Wasn't impressed with the PH salad. The "bacon" was more like soft ham and there were hardly any blue cheese crumbles! The portion size was very small for $14. I was also disappointed in the service. They made you feel like you were bothering them.

The food here is awesome. I always get meal preps along with eating their meals. The chicken here is so so tender. I haven't tried anything I did not liked. This is a great place if you love to eat healthy along with on a high protein diet. They also have a variety of gluten free items which I have also enjoyed. Highly recommend!!
I loved this place and concept. Fast and healthy food. I got the sexy bitch bowl with bison. Absolutely delicious! I wish they would open a location in Denver soon!!

Diamond one of the workers so helpful and informational. I'm a macro counter so I sometimes ask the macro count of foods, they didn't have it off the top of their head but they knew where they could get it. 

The place it modern and has photos of bodybuilders all over the place, I can see it being some what intimidating makes it look like a "GYM BRO" atmosphere but after you get past that its cool and chill, I honestly don't mind it I think it motivation. Along with the decor a nice big TV for you to watch the games! 

They have a wall for titled "who's in da house?" with bodybuilders, fighters and other famous people that have been to Protein house.

I for one spent a lot there the first time 70$+ 0.o but I did order 4 things... and purchased a shirt. The food items are high quality worth the price.

They just need to open on in summerlin then I'd be a happy camper!

Best turkey burger I've had in a long time....  it's a small place that I would probably frequent if it weren't for the high prices. I could understand higher prices when using organic meat etc... They don't use that here so I'm not sure where the high prices come in. Still pretty good to me.

Great food and it is super filling. I really enjoyed the experiment except the soft core porn on the windows. Don't get me wrong, I get the fitness world and culture of showing off the body but there is a difference between fitness modeling and provacative modeling. Until those are down I will take my business to Greens and Proteins. I choose to support good morals

Open late for late gym goers. They have great smoothies such as Green Beast which was the super green smoothie, literally and substituted for vegan protein. The Hulk was good, the pear taste added sweetness to it which was great. As for 
Chocolate PB Crush, it tasted like a candy bar without the guilt. 

Great place for healthy food and gym goers!

I have a slight addition to this place when I'm between workouts or classes! 

If you're looking for a healthy place to grab a bite and refuel your muscles with lean protein and veggies and whole food carbs, this is where you come! 

My favorites are the SHREDD bowl, the Vitamin c juice, and the PBJ pancake! -- their bison and steak in any meal are super tender and delicious! The PBJ Pancake has to be a favorite of mine when I'm having a sweets craving! It's made with whole wheat pasta and whey protein and sugar free jelly and peanut butter! 

If you want to add flavor, there is a large assortment of condiments ranging from Sriracha to Liquid aminos!

If you download their app, you can get rewards and earn points towards future meals! 

There may be protein cookies and brownies by the front counter too!

Went here tonight for the first time.  Surprisingly, they don't have a lot of vegetarian options so I ordered the berry acai bowl which was listed for $7.99 and recommended to me by a friendly female staff member. A friendly male staff member rang me up and told me it would be $10.00. I told him it's listed on the menu for $7.99. He said "oh, that's for the smoothies, the bowls cost more" Well, that would be ok if it were actually listed anywhere on the menu, but it clearly states "smoothies and acai bowls $7.99" I thought maybe it was just a mistake on the menu so I looked above where they have the entire menu written on chalk boards. Once again, clearly listed "smoothies and acai bowls $7.99" I then asked the female employee if the price listed was wrong. She said "yes, the bowls are more because there's more toppings" I said "then you really should change the prices on the menus" she said "I know, I told him (the owner, manager??) that". The whole thing just seemed wrong to me. On top of that, it wasn't even that good, I've had much better acai bowls for less money and considering they were in Orange County where things are usually more expensive, that's saying a lot.
Talk about fresh ...this spicy thai chicken wrap is definitely that.. The peanut sauce tho im glad i got it on the side it has an after taste & its lite on the chicken. Next tine i'll try a smoothie

Ugh, I would get broke because of this place. It's delicious and healthy! There are options for vegans and vegetarians. You have bowls, smoothies, breakfast, lunch, dinner, and dessert. I usually just come for a post workout smoothie. I typically get the Green Blast, which is lower in carbs. Their plant powered bowl was everything. I got my veggies, quinoa, and protein. They provide a nutrition menu to account for macros. They have options for bread like wheat, Ezekiel (which is good for my blood sugar). It's 5 minutes away from EOS and Vegas Discount Nutrition. Great location and food. Service has always been great. It's worth a try, so just venture out here and order something.

The only thing I would recommend is making the portobello mushroom buns a little softer!

On the recommendation from Mel, Terri and Shirley, I decided to check this place out.  It seems to be a fitting place for me.  So, I met fellow Yelper Loren and her boyfriend for lunch.  Protein House is in a strip mall in Green Valley.  I didn't have any problems finding the place nor parking.  I walked in and sat down and checked out the menu.  They have a pretty extensive menu that could fill all of my nutritional needs.  I decided to go with a protein bowl, called the Lolo bowl.  The bowl had Chocolate Whey Protein, strawberries, blueberries, bananas, and oats.  It was really filling and a perfect treat for a hot summer day.

Loren and Skyler had a Mahi Tuna sandwich that looked amazing.  The decor was interesting.  There was a wall full of posters of hot fitness competitors, called the wall of fame.  

I am pretty sure that I would return here to have a P.W.O. meal again.  

I would love to see a nutritional breakdown for their meals there.  I am one that keeps tracks of my macros.  That would be a great touch.

Love this place. Have to come if I'm ever in the area.  Every time I get a drink it is so satisfying. I believe you definitely get your money's worth here. 

Last time I was here I ended getting to shaker cups for free. Still going through the whole menu, and I can't get over their protein smoothies.

I love Protein House. I crave it. I'm sad we don't have one in LA. Portions are BIG, menu is varied and full of options and the customer service is good - the gals and guys at the counter are always pleasant. :)

Smoothies are to die for delicious. Vanilla Gorilla & Peanut Butter Dream are my picks. Also try the peanut butter protein cupcakes. They're DELISH and good to take on the go. 

The fact that you can build your own bowl, burger or salad is dope, too. And you can choose your protein size portions! The ahi rocks and the pancakes are a must try when you feel like breakfast.

Protein House is casual, tasty and reasonably priced. Plus you never know who you're gonna see in there - athletes, fitness enthusiasts and healthy eaters from all over flock there for the food....and a hopeful glimpse or meeting with IFBB Figure Champ and badass owner of PH, Larissa Reis. She's the boss lady and happy to snap a picture with ya in front of their branded wall. Great spot - Awesome Food - Good Peeps

Excellent. Food always fresh, delivered to their location daily. Menu is completely flexible. Nothing you can't substitute which is rare including shakes and smoothies. Started Meal Prep as well and comparing against several other companies from the East Coast to the West Coast, after completing a 3rd week trial, I do have to be honest and say: "In deed the ProteinHouse has proven to be the best". That includes the service from the staff couldn't be friendlier, accommodating, offering great guidance. The Meal Prep is fresh, well presented and packed nicely.
I had the SW bowl. It was very filling and service was quick. Would definitely go back, but would try something different.

I remember seeing the owner on that show,  Mystery Diners, which is sort of like Undercover Boss minus the feely-touchy ending.  In this instance, the yolked Brazilian owner was getting screwed by her staff and gets busted.  I saw that the scene took place here in Las Vegas, but never thought to look the place up.

Anyhow, the place is a lot like Greens and Protiens, without the rush and with a more user friendly menu with much more enticing names,  if you ask me.  Sexy Bitch?!?  C'mon now...just imagine,  someone eating out a sexy...well you get the point.

The ultra-modern look also adorns the dining area,  similar to G&P, except this place uses tougher colors,  yeah!  It's like Cobra Commander eats here while Oscar the Grouch eats at G&P with Kermit the Frog.  I wouldn't even flinch if I heard someone slamming their plate to the table after 3 rep bites with an emphatic grunt....Arrrrggghhhhh!

The ginormous screen was also playing some NCAA games,  which was a plus.  Seems like they do everything big up in hur, I swear that TV needed Olympic doping tests #pacquiao...and so did my PH Burger.  

Being in this place gave me the feeling to go big or go home, the no pain no gain mentality.  I inquired whether I should opt for the single patty, or go for the Muscle Builder Burger, 2 bison patties topped with bacon.  The girl at the register said the single should suit me just find, when in fact I can picture her saying, "not with those puny arms," like in the State Farm commercial with Discount Double Check A Rod.  She was right tho...

The wifey ordered the Sexy Bitch without hesitation,  just cause she is.  The bowl was a healthy dose of lightly grilled veggies and quinoa topped with a nice slab of salmon.  I took a few bites and nodded in approval. 

Overall, the Protein House was pretty good and a great option for meatheads, health nuts,  clean eaters and average Joe dodge ball...check it out for yourself and don't forget to check in for 10% off your entire meal.  Arrrrggghhhhh, sorry,  had to...

Pretty good to come eat and have a shake after the gym!

Pretty pricey, BUT what healthy place isn't? 

The shakes were tasty and the food was pretty good!

I'd come back.
Great food and smoothies, a bit on the pricey side, but overall pretty not bad.

Great spot!! Love coming here to load up on healthy protein smoothies and their different rice bowls. 

U have to get the Greek bowl and ADD steak. You will definitely thank me later. They have a long list of smoothies / protein shakes for after your workout. 

Very hard to go wrong here!

Came out to Vegas for a getaway and HAD to try Protein House. 
I ordered the Chocolate Monster Protein Pancakes. It consists of two HUGE chocolate chip pancakes topped with bananas, walnuts and sugar free chocolate sauce. It was delicious but with a bit too much of an artificial sweetness to it. I could only eat half since they were so big plus loaded with protein. 
I wish they used all natural ingredients though. That was a downer in my opinion. 
I also ordered a Southwest Bowl to-go. Lean steak with black beans, veggies and brown rice. I had that later on my ride home. So fresh and good!

I really enjoyed the food there although I was disappointed with the quality of the protein powder they use for their pancakes and other recipes. It contain artificial sweeteners and ingredients that are not healthy, so even though the pancakes were high in protein and sugar free, I still considered them "unhealthy."
I think Protein House has a great thing going, but they should change the brand of protein the use to make it TRULY a healthy eating place.

Created by bodybuilders with customers who are into fitness and their health in mind, Protein House's offerings fit in perfectly with those who are eating clean, or trying to.  Located conveniently across the street from the Gold's gym on Eastern near Serene and down the street from LVAC, this has been a good spot for us to eat post-workout.  Breakfasts, burgers, bowls, salads, juices, and smoothies are on the menu, with options to choose from one of PH's creations or make your own, which I prefer.  I've had a turkey bowl and a sirloin steak bowl, with either the quinoa or brown rice, adding mushrooms, tomatoes,or broccoli.  I monitor the portion sizes of my protein and carbs, and PH's menu helps by listing the ounces of their servings knowing that there are other people like me who want to know those details.  Andrew, the co-owner and the picture of muscle and fitness himself, has been there each time we've eaten there, manning the register and always checking on us after we get our orders. He said that nutritional info for all the menu items is coming soon, which will be another feather in PH's cap.  Eat clean, train mean -  try Protein House if this is your mantra.

I am writing an update. My husband and I decided to give this place another try and I am so glad I did. Their southwest bowl is my favorite. They have made some staff changes and our food came out within 10 minutes, which for a made to order, healthy food place thats excellent.
This place fits my healthy lifestyle. I can find fun food options. Everything on the menu is good. Lately I've been addicted to the acai berry blast Bowl!!!

Delicious and healthy! Right down the street from the gym, perfect for a post workout meal. I was so impressed. I can't wait to go back. The salmon burger was absolutely delicious. Everyone wanted to try it and i was reluctant to share. The side salad was amazing! I can still taste that dressing. Yumm.

I am a fitness freak so when I was headed to Las Vegas I had to stop by the Protein House. Place is geared to people wanting a healthy choice when it comes to eating but still care about taste. Protein enfused pancakes what else can I say. Ordered the Chocolate Monster Pancakes which are Multigrain whey pancakes with chocolate protein syrup topped with walnuts and bananas. Taste incredible. Friend order a steak burrito with egg whites and avocado in a multigrain tortilla which he said was delicious. Wish I lived in Vegas just for this restaurant.
I LOVE this place! It's my go to meal place. My favorite's are the Hulk smoothie a MUST TRY and the salmon wrap! Everything on this menu is amazing. Reasonable price and they don't slack on quality.

Amazing food Their Special Satay Bowl with Asparagus and Brown Rice is off the charts. Generous portions and great balance of selections fuels this place with healthy meals. Your body will thank you later. Amazing selection from Bison to Beef and some of the best Green combos I have seen in the Vegas Valley - A gem working snacking at!

I've been dying to come here for years. I live in LA and hadn't been able to stop in when I've been in Vegas until now.... NOT impressed. The food was horrible, the cookie n' cream coffee I got tasted horrible, we're sitting in here eating out of plastic bowls with plasticware. Bland tasteless food. I understand it's for people in prep for competition but I make better tasting food than this and I suck at cooking. Not coming back.

Amazing that is all everything we have tried us awesome! Great food and good choices staff is knowledgeable and friendly! Food tastes incredible! Do yourself a favor eat clean! We aren't body builders yet but we are watching what we eat and I love this place!

I think I am one of the first to get to experience this place and let me just say ..ah now this is what I needed. It's like a Tropical Smoothie meets Greens and Proteins meets Coffee Shop that was spliced with a healthy Egg Works. Lots of options meat, salads and vegetarian dishes, breakfast, coffee, smoothies. I can see this as being a healthy option for those doing shows, working out, training for fights, on Paleo or looking to indulge while staying healthy.

I ordered three things, I like to eat what can I say? The best I can do to stifle my inner fat kid is to force-feed him healthy meals a majority of the time. 3 steps forward, one step back. Anyway, I got the bison cheeseburger, PH breakfast, and BBQ chicken bowl with quinoa (with BBQ sauce flavored with stevia instead of sugar, damn they're on it for those of you that like to drizzle sauce all over your food). A little more expensive from most places but about on par when I'm ordering things like bison, which isn't cheap. When I first started eating it, of course I wanted to compare it to Greens and Proteins but it's not really the same thing. Greens and protein is healthy and has good health alternatives for vegans and vegetarians but outside of several items it lacks sufficient protein options for me. So where Greens and Proteins lacks Protein House makes up in protein (meat, chicken, egg whites), alternatives for customized shakes, and smoothies, and easier to stay within how my friends and I eat. So can't really compare the two, they're both good. It's like comparing apples and oranges, both fruit, but they are both in different categories. 

 In any event, they're still working out some kinks but this place has the potential to continue expanding and get better. Now I know some of you picky eaters will complain that it's just okay but I also heard this from the same person who dislikes fish and complains at sushi restaurants. Wtf! Hey it might just not be your thing. But it's simple, if you need your protein, you need your veggies, you need your carbs and you need healthy, this is the spot. This isn't necessarily a place I would go to indulge but it is exactly the place I would go to keep me on track during the week so I can indulge later in the weekend. (See fat kid reference above.)

I have only been here a couple times. My first visit I ordered the BBQ bowl, it was good. Nothing memorable or great that made me want to come back and order it again. More than willing to come back and have another meal but the price of the food and quality/taste may not be too worth it for me... I am also not a fan of the atmosphere. I like the layout, tables, colors and flooring but the music is loud and makes me feel like I am out at the club. I, by no means am a person who wants peace and quiet but it is too loud to enjoy a conversation with someone I am with and I am sorry but the photos on the wall are just interesting... I understand it is a health and fitness conscious establishment and I am all about it and love that but the photos on the wall are over the top fitness pictures. (Sorry I forgot to take a photo, it would help explain my thoughts) And this is a very casual place. All in all, not bad but I will drive 5 minutes down the street to greens and proteins. Usually my go to for a healthy dish.
If you're looking for quality healthy food come here.  Every time I fly to Vegas from NY it's a go to spot

Ordered two chicken bowls. Drove 15 minutes home after a hardcore workout with my wife only to find out we were given a steak wrap and steak bowl, both of which had items we don't like (onions, peppers, lettuce). Called to notify and they took my name and said I could get two free meals the next time. We'll see how that goes.  Oh yeah, tipped couple bucks and didn't get a receipt.

I have gone sever times here the food is great, prices are a bit hight but I manage, the only think I would suggest them going back to would be their bowls, the colorful bowls they have now make the place not only look tacky but a downgrade and make the food not that pleasing to the naked eye I would say, the simple white bowls they had, looked great for the restaurant  plain and simple ,fancy. Just a simple review from a loyal customer hopefully they see this and address what am sure not the only one with the same thoughts.

John.

Sometimes I order two meals from protein house just to get through my day. That way, I'm able to eat healthily while on the go. The quality of food is always great and the ability to modify nearly everything is awesome too! Keep up the good work!

I love this place! I once drove 200miles from LA just to eat here, made a trip out of it but this was my main reason for coming. 
I must say that if I were a local I wouldn't eat here that often due to the high price. I think everything is slightly overpriced by a buck or so. I only eat here when I'm in Vegas bc it's good food and unlike what I'd find on the strip.

I love all the food they serve! It's always fresh and healthy--everything a fitness junkie eats all in one place. However, the only bad thing I can say about the place is how my order always seems to get messed up in one way or another every time I order here. Whether it be something added that I didn't want or something that I did want that's not put on the plate, it happens every time! I also don't like how they do not keep the restaurant clean at all times. Whenever I'm there, there's crumbs on the floor or tables not cleaned up after, which I guess the white tile, walls, and furniture don't help to hide but still, ewww. There's always at least five to six people working so I would think they would keep it clean at all times. Other than that the atmosphere is really chic, plus it makes me feel expensive and healthy all at the same time. I would recommend that if you were to order a breakfast item, to get the Protein Pancake Combo! I'm addicted, it is so good and so is every other item on the menu.

These guns love protein and I was excited when I finally got the chance to eat here considering I live across town.  Walking through the front door might have you wanting to sing "All Eyez on me" because everyone stops what they are doing to stare you up and down.  Be prepared to flex ;) I do have to agree with the other reviews in that i wish they had friendlier customer service.  I was never greeted and I did feel a bit like I was bothering them when I gave them my order.  The space is great and everything I ordered was very good.  So good, that I was back a few days later.  I wish they had more locations as I would frequent this place if it was closer to home.

Very gimicky. You can totally tell this is where the "cool kids" come to be seen regardless of how bad the food is. I ordered a Southwest bowl with extra meat total was $25 dollars  meat was so tough it was like chewing on leather, was not tender at all. So if you want to go there so you can take some selfie's and tell people via social media you're there, so you can get some likes. That's definitely the place to go for that. Me no thanks won't pay extra for below avg food just to say I'm there. For $25 I can go to Echo & Rig and get a nice skirt steak.
The single best new concept in "fast" food. Healthy and delicious. I've eaten in several locations around the U.S. Great menu, unusual items, something for Paleo, Vegan, you name it.

What a surprise! My husband and I, came to the Protein house for lunch.
We ordered the:
S.O.S, $11.99 Grilled Salmon, Spring Mix, Grapes,Celery, Apples, Walnuts, Feta, and balsamic vinaigrette.
I loved it, the Salmon was moist and great testing, the fruit and veggie combination was perfect, so was the vinaigrette.

The SHRRD Salad $11.99 Chicken, Quinoa,Spring Mix, Cucumber, Baby Tomato, Spinach, Avocado, Peas, Hard Boiled Egg, Balsamic Vinaigrette
My husband loved it! Chicken was tasty the veggies and everything in it was delish.
Couple of hours after lunch the Salmon was still in my mind! 
My husband was making plans for our next lunch there. 
The place was clean, neat and quite. The food is well worth the price you pay.
I just feel they need a larger menu board.

I've only eaten here one time and it was a to-go salad to pick up for work that night. I had the PH Tuna salad and it was AMAZING. The tuna was seared wonderfully and the flavors in that salad were awesome. I took out the celery and had cucumber because I'm not a fan of celery. The portion was large and I'm actually very glad about that because it lasted me all night at work (10 hour shift and the hospital's cafeteria wasn't open during my shift). It was filling enough for me to eat a little bit and come back to it. The produce was very fresh and the tuna was fresh and seasoned very nicely. I had the balsamic vinaigrette dressing and it went with the salad nicely. Next time I'll have to try the dressing it comes with but it wasn't an option with the online ordering. 

It's definitely not hard to find the place when you park. It's very clear with the nice big sign outside. I haven't dined indoors yet but it seemed inviting. I like the little impulse-buy sections they have with protein bars, drinks, etc. I'm excited to try more of what's on their menu. Next time I'm on that side of town I'll be trying out something different. It seems like it only gets better each time for most patrons! :)

I've been here with my husband a handful of times.  So far, everything that we've ordered has been delicious.  The meals are great if you're looking for healthier options.  This is the first place we've found so far in Vegas that serves bison meat.  

They have great cooks here, because a little seasoning goes a long way.  They do a good job keeping the food clean, not too much oil, not too much of anything that allows the natural ingredients to take on it's flavor.  If you're looking to add more flavor, they have probably 10 different types of hot sauces, sweet sauces that you can add on yourself.

For example, they have an omelette made with 6 egg whites, a little bit of ham, folded over, topped with a few spoonful of cottage cheese and voila, protein packed meal.  They serve this meal with a variety of freshly cut fruits like melon, pineapple to end on a sweet note.  

The average price is around $11 for a meal, but check them out on Groupon for better deals.  Download their app, so you can rack up free meals or smoothies with the online frequent card.  The current promotion with Yelp check-in for 10% off your order.  

We recently discovered the protein pancakes topped with their protein frozen yogurt and it was definitely a fun dessert.  I can't see how this was even good for me, but it wasn't overly sweet and I didn't feel disgusted, so it was just right up my alley.  Totally hits the spot to satisfy that sweet craving.

We like to take out of town guests for a healthy meal because we really like it here.  

One last thing.... Don't be intimidated by the jack-up looking dudes that eat here too, because everyone is friendly here. 

Check out my delicious pictures. Yum!

Going to vegas on prep ..... protein house you have literally saved my life and time allll weekend !! 

Food is great !! (For being prep approved) 

Not somewhere I would go being off prep as it did taste bland . 
Customer service was great ! 

And I would definitely come back !

This place had the best burger I've ever had and it turns out to be vegan. Unfortunately, they changed their meat patties from Beyond brand to Impossible. That is a huge difference!! Texture, color, flavor and smell are completely opposite. When they changed the product and didn't tell me, I knew something was off on my first bite. I have a very sensitive palette and can sense even a tiny change. The impossible meat smelled and tasted like wheat, dry consistency and breaks apart easily. I used to order this 3x's a week and now I don't even want to order it anymore. Please bring back BEYOND meat!! Thank you.

Started with Green Beast smoothie and my Partner started with Summer tryst, both were excellent drinks. I ordered the the Muscle boy and she ordered Chocolate monster pancake and also tried their brewed coffee. The coffee is above average, my muscle boy is a good source of protein but I won't crave for it. The pancake has its own character and will appeal to protein craving person. 
Service is average I don't like the plastic forks and they can add a little ambiance and cleanliness. Buy a Groupon so there will be value otherwise there are better Lunch and Breakfast place much better for the money.

After moving to Henderson my husband and I were anxious to try this place.  Since we hadn't been before we were not sure what to order.  The woman at the counter was rude and short with us- I told her it was our first time and she handed me a paper menu, not explaining anything or asking any questions.  You'd think they would want new customers but based off her attitude that was clearly not the goal. We both decided on acai bowls.  They were absolutely phenomenal- five stars for food. It's unfortunate the customer service didn't match the food. My husband is a professional athlete so we were hoping we'd found a new "spot."

This was probably my favorite spot in Vegas during the Olympia. I had the PH hash and let me say that it was point! It came with bison (medium rare), diced potatoes, egg whites and caramelized onions. Man I was in heaven, I only wish that there was one here in orange County, CA. This really is the spot for healthy eating that actually tasse good!
